D_BestiaryData.Spider-Lore3: "**** THIS IS NOT OKAY, ****** THINGS SHOULD NOT EXIST! WHY THE **** DID SOMEONE MAKE THIS. I ******* QUIT, GET ME OFF THIS ******* PLANET. Why is it always spiders? Why couldn't it be butterflies?"
D_BestiaryData.Snow_Slug-Lore3: "A viscid? Out here? Oh damn it, it hit me! Jax wait, I can't move!"
D_BestiaryData.Chamios-Lore3: "AH the ol' shammy. Stupid little goat thing. Bear fodder. Feeder of wolves. Meat on legs."
D_BestiaryData.Lava_Hunter_Spawns-Lore3: "Agh- no- oof- get OFF me you gross little creepy thing- AHH it BIT me!"
D_BestiaryData.Sheep-Lore3: "Ah c'mon Bessie there's a good- no, no not that way, Bessie please, we've been over this. It's just a haircut, it's getting chillier and I need your wool- OOF. Hey, get back here!"
D_BestiaryData.SulfurWorm-Lore3: "And here I was thinking the Sandworms were the worst of 'em..."
D_BestiaryData.Snow_Leopard-Lore3: "Aren't they just the fuzziest? I've had these two following me for the last few days, some would say they're just exhibiting standard hunting behaviour but me? I know better. I swear they are this close to accepting me into their furry little family, I can just feel it... I wonder if an orbital laser would work for playtime..."
D_BestiaryData.Snow_Striker-Lore3: "At first I thought it was all in my head, no one else thought we were being followed. But, sticking with my gut is why I'm still here, and the rest of my team aren't. It starts as a flare of dread in your chest, if you feel a prickle down the back of your neck, then you're already too late."
D_BestiaryData.Deer_Variant-Lore3: "Blast me! I always thought my team were saying 'he's quick', didn't know these critters had a real name"
D_BestiaryData.Baby_Deer-Lore3: "Bro. Every ol' mate and his dog have had to kill these little critters. It's survival. If you're hurt... tired or slow... They're easier to hunt... But the sound they make when they die... A heavy meal in more ways than one."
D_BestiaryData.Rockdog-Lore3: "Buggers get more and more pissed off until they explode at someone. Frustrating as HELL to deal with."
D_BestiaryData.Orka-Lore3: "By the time you hear the ice crunching behind you, it's already got your leg."
D_BestiaryData.Eagle-Lore3: "Careful of the cheeky buggers. They're not dangerous or anything, but they'll steal food right out from under ya nose. Hell, they'll rip the seals right off your dropship windows."
D_BestiaryData.Kea-Lore3: "Careful of the cheeky buggers. They're not dangerous or anything, but they'll steal food right out from under ya nose. Hell, they'll rip the seals right off your dropship windows."
D_BestiaryData.Caveworm-Lore3: "Cave clearing. We all have to do it some time... Though... They're like roaches, always come back eventually."
D_BestiaryData.Forest_Wolf-Lore3: "Chills. Down. Your. Spine. You try getting to sleep while a ghastly choir of howling surrounds ya makeshift camp. Its downright unsettling."
D_BestiaryData.Snow_Wolf-Lore3: "Chills. Down. Your. Spine. You try getting to sleep while a ghastly choir of howling surrounds ya makeshift camp. Its downright unsettling."
D_BestiaryData.Geothermal_Spider-Lore3: "Cool, get a spider and make it bigger, angrier and faster. How lovely, I'm sure everyone will love these... Perhaps next time we could try something a little nicer, like butterflies?"
D_BestiaryData.RockGolem-Lore3: "Creatures of interest? No one said anything about banging my head against a literal rock!"
D_BestiaryData.RockGolem_Juvenile-Lore3: "Creatures of interest? No one said anything about banging my head against a literal rock!"
D_BestiaryData.Crocodile-Lore3: "Crocodiles are... easy. They try to kill and eat you. Now the UDA... That's a reptile to be afraid of."
D_BestiaryData.Swamp_Quadruped-Lore3: "Cute lil turtle guys with their floppy eyes, running all over the damn place. No idea what to do with them, but they make my day each time I see 'em"
D_BestiaryData.GhostCrocodile-Lore3: "Damn near thought the sand was breathing. Turns out it was just one of them Ghost Crocs deciding which one of us to eat first."
D_BestiaryData.Komodo-Lore3: "Damn things have a cesspool in their mouths. Some... Fifty different bacterial strains. Handful of which are exceedingly septic. AND a venom gland in their lower jaw. WHY."
D_BestiaryData.IceMammoth-Lore3: "Did you see the SIZE of that thing? Screw it, I'm out. I am never taking another Norex contract again!"
D_BestiaryData.Chew-Lore3: "Don't let the big eyes fool you. I tried to pet one once - still can't bend my wrist right."
D_BestiaryData.Rabbit_Variant-Lore3: "Don't pet the fluffy little darlings?? Why on earth would I listen to that rubbish? This one here is called Imelda and her friend over here is called Twiggy. They help me to finish off my dinner each night and in return I , uh, ATTEMPT to give them some snuggles."
D_BestiaryData.Predator_Bird-Lore3: "First it's bears and then wolves and now we got these damn things dive-bombing us from the skies? I can't work in these conditions."
D_BestiaryData.Needler-Lore3: "Good god, who thought it was a good idea to mix those genes together? I mean- HELLO? This thing is deadl-"
D_BestiaryData.Buffalo-Lore3: "Great big ol' lumbering things. At first I thought they were only good for eatin', then I realized you could tame em! And heck if didn't that make things ten times easier on this dang rock."
D_BestiaryData.Chicken-Lore3: "Henrietta here has made a huge difference in my time planetside. She's been a cute clucky little companion and more importantly a good source of eggs. I know she'll stop laying eventually but... we'll cross that road when we get to it I guess."
D_BestiaryData.Chamios_Variant-Lore3: "I don't care how 'safe' they are, the eyes freak me out."
D_BestiaryData.Alpha_Wolf_Boss-Lore3: "I don't know which one of those crackpot UDA gene jocks hates us prospectors... but whoever made this thing is sadistic."
D_BestiaryData.Cougar-Lore3: "I had to treat a Prospectors severe lacerations on MULTIPLE occasions. They continually attempted to feed and pet large feline species.... Claimed to have discovered a new 'kitty cat' species in the fringe zone.... I've not heard from them in a while."
D_BestiaryData.Lava_Hunter-Lore3: "I mean, I know us prospectors aren't the most creative bunch but this name just makes sense. It lives in lava and it hunts literally anything that moves. And the sound it makes? I've still been getting nightmares from it months later... "
D_BestiaryData.Desert_Striker-Lore3: "I mean, have you SEEN the claws on those things?! I am never going into the Volcanic areas again. EVER."
D_BestiaryData.Bear_Cub-Lore3: "I mean, they're cute and all but... a mans gotta eat. I'm not proud of it, but sometimes these little fellas are all that stand between me and starvation."
D_BestiaryData.Pronghorn-Lore3: "I swear. It's like they have magnets in their horns. You spend ages stalk'n them, get up as close as you can...  line up your shot... THUNK! Arrow falls to the ground.  Looks like I'm going hungry tonight."
D_BestiaryData.BatDog-Lore3: "I was assigned to Sci-ops in the fringe zone. Chasing some theory Dr Lee had about something living around pockets of molten lava. We always had our eyes on the horizon, searching for that tell tale red glow..."
D_BestiaryData.Kiwi-Lore3: "I was telling Dave the other day, I don't care how much national pride you have for 'em, those things are downright useless. No meat on 'em and they can't even fly! So what if I'm from Australia-"
D_BestiaryData.Irradiated_Mutation-Lore3: "If a Spectre's what you become, then a Wraith's what's left when the radiation finishes the job."
D_BestiaryData.Tundra_Monkey-Lore3: "If it's shaking, chittering, and throwing something at you? Congratulations - you've met a Gribbler."
D_BestiaryData.Irradiated_Prospector-Lore3: "If that's what's left of us after the job... maybe the bonus ain't worth it."
D_BestiaryData.Slinker-Lore3: "If you see that shadow moving through the snow, it's already too late. The damn thing's watching you."
D_BestiaryData.Hopping_Creature-Lore3: "If you see the mud twitch, it's already too late. They don't stalk you - they just appear, teeth first."
D_BestiaryData.Hopping_Creature_Swamp-Lore3: "If you see the mud twitch, it's already too late. They don't stalk you - they just appear, teeth first."
D_BestiaryData.Flightless_Tank-Lore3: "If you think a Sandhorn looks slow, wait until you make it mad."
D_BestiaryData.Reaver-Lore3: "Imagine a massive lobster, but it's evil. That's a Reaver."
D_BestiaryData.Raptor_Desert-Lore3: "It ain't a sandworm... but it'll do."
D_BestiaryData.Forest_Deer-Lore3: "It just tastes better. Earth feed is crap in comparison... Sure we have chem residue and exotics, but not decades of pollution and microplastics... Hah... I might grow a third leg, and I'm okay with that, so long as I don't have to eat that printed earth-side ****."
D_BestiaryData.Desert_Deer-Lore3: "It just tastes better. Earth feed is crap in comparison... Sure we have chem residue and exotics, but not decades of pollution and microplastics... I might grow a third leg, and I'm okay with that, so long as I don't have to eat that printed earth-side ****."
D_BestiaryData.Bee-Lore3: "Just when you think your day can't get any worse... Bees. And not just any bees, there's no suit in orbit that can keep these little ****ers out. I swear they can smell fear."
D_BestiaryData.Arctic_Moa-Lore3: "Life will find a way... Directly into a prospectors stomach."
D_BestiaryData.Moa-Lore3: "Life will find a way... Directly into a prospectors stomach."
D_BestiaryData.Lava_Slug-Lore3: "Like a trail of snot, couldn't believe it when I woke up and looked out my window and this lil fella was circling my base. Needless to say I got out of there pretty quickly, really miss that base though..."
D_BestiaryData.Swamp_Slug-Lore3: "Like a trail of snot, couldn't believe it when I woke up and looked out my window and this lil fella was circling my base. Needless to say I got out of there pretty quickly, really miss that base though..."
D_BestiaryData.Horse-Lore3: "Moas. They're noisy and they **** everywhere. I'm sick of em... These guys? WAY better. They may not be as fast, but it sure beats cleaning bird droppings all over your base."
D_BestiaryData.Cattle-Lore3: "My pops back home used to run a farm before the climate crisis wiped everything out. Looking after the cattle here reminds me of him."
D_BestiaryData.MiniHippo-Lore3: "Nah mate, nah, hear me out... 'Dribbo' - get it? Cause it's a drunk hippo. I'm calling it now, it'll catch on, the other Aussies will love it."
D_BestiaryData.Swamp_Bird-Lore3: "Never thought much of Flamingos on earth... this fella though, I've seen them knock a prospector out cold in one kick. Want some advice? Stay outta range."
D_BestiaryData.Bear-Lore3: "Not your first thought. One of the biggest initial dangers being bears.... You start to take it seriously after a crewmate is taken or mauled. You know they ******* start eating from the lower half of your damn body? I'll.... I'll never get the screams out of my head"
D_BestiaryData.FleshSac_Floater-Lore3: "Nothin' but a sack of farts if you ask me. Go on, poke one and see what happens."
D_BestiaryData.Hammerhead_Slug-Lore3: "Oh god, this stuff stinks. Stu, how long did it take you to get the goop out of your suit? I don't have a spare..."
D_BestiaryData.Arctic_Bat-Lore3: "Oi, Rob, get over here! Reckon I've found once of them nests they've been harping on about. Hey, don't go near it, haven't you read the repor-" Recording Terminated.
D_BestiaryData.Cave_Bat-Lore3: "Oi, Rob, get over here! Reckon I've found once of them nests they've been harping on about. Hey, don't go near it, haven't you read the repor-" Recording Terminated.
D_BestiaryData.Tusker-Lore3: "Once you get used to the two-sets-of-eyes thing these fellas are actually pretty cute. My latest one even fought off a wolf, I'd like to see a Moa do that!"
D_BestiaryData.DragonFly-Lore3: "One second the swamp's quiet, the next something green and angry is trying to jam its stinger in your visor. Step near a nest and you'll learn real fast what 'territorial' means."
D_BestiaryData.Tundra_Deer-Lore3: "One startled, and the whole herd vanished like smoke. Don't waste time trying to sneak up-they've been watching long before you got here."
D_BestiaryData.Bounder_Desert-Lore3: "One twitch of an ear and it's gone. These things survive on nerves and luck alone."
D_BestiaryData.Stomper-Lore3: "Peaceful until you make eye contact. Then it's you or the bird."
D_BestiaryData.Rabbit-Lore3: "Quick little critters keep gettin' into my food stores. If they keep mucking me around I'll see if they have better manners as a pair of socks."
D_BestiaryData.Horse_Standard-Lore3: "Reginald here isn't just a steed, though he's very handy at helping me move around the place. He's got such a personality, I'd have never have bothered with getting myself a horse back home but now... now I see why so many people love them so darn much."
D_BestiaryData.Storca-Lore3: "Reminds me of my old greyhound back home, if you're able to make friends with one they're kinda cute..."
D_BestiaryData.Ape-Lore3: "Rounding up a few creatures here and there is one thing but... a lab experiment that broke out? No thank you, I'll stick to mining exotics the hard way after this one."
D_BestiaryData.Ape_Juvenile-Lore3: "Rounding up a few creatures here and there is one thing but... a lab experiment that broke out? No thank you, I'll stick to mining exotics the hard way after this one."
D_BestiaryData.Scorpion_Boss-Lore3: "She is perfect. I've been a practicing geneticist over a long 25 year career. I can only hope, one day, to create something so beautiful." - Dr Lee
D_BestiaryData.Elephant-Lore3: "Something was... lost in the genetic reconstruction of this species. African Elephants on earth are intelligent, self-aware creatures. In multiple instances they've passed the MSR test. Icarus Loxodonta do not react as expected when presented with the mirror test. We did... I... something isn't right."
D_BestiaryData.Wild_Boar-Lore3: "Space bacon. My favourite part of this cursed rock."
D_BestiaryData.Lava_Blueback-Lore3: "Sure they look a bit weird at first but you get used to it, my girl Spot is just the cutest. The way she calls out for me and shakes her head with happiness, it just... makes me smile."
D_BestiaryData.Drone-Lore3: "TPS are either all completely crazy, or fighting for our freedom. You be the judge."
D_BestiaryData.Raptor-Lore3: "Tamed one once. Fastest ride you'll ever have-right up until it remembers it's the apex, and you're just lunch with reins."
D_BestiaryData.Zebra-Lore3: "The real question is: are they white with black stripes? Or are they black with white stripes? Steve bet against me and he still owes me from last time..."
D_BestiaryData.Mange_Wolf-Lore3: "Them creepy lookin' things refuse to walk away if they see you're injured."
D_BestiaryData.Lava_Komodo-Lore3: "There I was just minding my own business trying to make it past the lava floes and then WHACK! This thing comes outta nowhere and almost knocked me in. Cheeky git."
D_BestiaryData.Gas_Flyer-Lore3: "They are strangely beautiful, nice to look at from a distance though. I wouldn't want to get too close to one, I quite like my brain the way it is."
D_BestiaryData.Cat-Lore3: "They seem to be adapting well to th-jfghlk ijdpfg83h4nds iopsfldg WHISKERS! GET OFF THERE"
D_BestiaryData.SandScuttler-Lore3: "They won't touch you unless you get between them and a fresh corpse. Problem is, sometimes you're the fresh corpse they're waiting for."
D_BestiaryData.Desert_Scorpion-Lore3: "This doesn't taste like lobster. **** are they thinking."
D_BestiaryData.Arctic_Scorpion-Lore3: "This doesn't taste like lobster. **** are they thinking?!"
D_BestiaryData.Landshark_Boss-Lore3: "This is exactly the kind of aberration I've talked about before. It displays such unique biology... Everything is comparatively simple on earth... I'm sure its genome contains a breakthrough genetic key... We just need more sample material" - Dr Amelia Tohu
D_BestiaryData.Jaguar-Lore3: "Tried to make a BIG ball of fiber hoping this little cutie would play with it. Didn't work out as well as I had hoped... But hey. You only need one kidney."
D_BestiaryData.Polar_Bear-Lore3: "Valued by prospectors for their meat but especially for their fur which can be used to craft armor to protect against the harsh climates of Icarus. Generally avoided by novice prospectors."
D_BestiaryData.Sandwyrm_Queen-Lore3: "WHAT DO YOU MEAN THEY CAN FLY NOW?!"
D_BestiaryData.Dog-Lore3: "WOOF! WOOOOOOOF WOOF WOOOOOF WOOF WOOF- Bessie?! How on earth did you get in here- ARE THOSE MY SOCKS?!"
D_BestiaryData.Teenage_Caveworm-Lore3: "We think they only surface to hunt... It's terrifying to think how many could be under our feet as we speak. Since they spend so much time underground, we just don't know much about them"
D_BestiaryData.Wooly_Zebra-Lore3: "We thought we were prepared, they said there was nothing living in there. All of a sudden Tony turns around and runs past me and I come face to face with that... THING.  It's eyes... there was just something about it's eyes..."
D_BestiaryData.Blueback-Lore3: "We were told it wouldn't affect us. Bull****. I could feel it. Even at a huge distance... Almost a... pressure? Like a looming feeling that some bad **** will happen unless you follow."
D_BestiaryData.Sandworm-Lore3: "We've seen radical mutation in species we've introduced into the terrazone. And over a relatively short period of time the change has been remarkable. Well, the Worms. This species is old. It's been exposed to exotic material for hundreds, maybe thousands of years. It's evolution is inseparable to this exposure. We must focus on learning more" - Dr Amelia Tohu
D_BestiaryData.Irradiated_Abomination-Lore3: "Whatever a Revenant used to be, it's long gone. At that point the radiation isn't killing them, it's feeding them."
D_BestiaryData.Flying_Tank-Lore3: "When a 'rock' the size of a cargo container stands up and takes off, you learn real quick which direction not to run."
D_BestiaryData.IceMammoth_WorldSpawn-Lore3: "While we appreciate new technology that allows us to maintain a healthy ecosystem, the potential of this technology being used unethically... more than likely it already is used unethically. We deserve better, you deserve better." - TPS Spokesperson
D_BestiaryData.Mammoth-Lore3: "While we appreciate new technology that allows us to maintain a healthy ecosystem, the potential of this technology being used unethically... more than likely it already is used unethically. We deserve better, you deserve better." - TPS Spokesperson
D_BestiaryData.Yeti-Lore3: "Yeah I had a friend back on Earth who was super into Bigfoot, imagine if he'd seen THESE!"
D_BestiaryData.Giant_Roach-Lore3: "You don't hear them first - you feel it. Legs like scaffolding all around you, and then something brushes your neck... and you faceplant straight into the marsh."
D_BestiaryData.Roat-Lore3: "You get used to them after a while, funny little things. Some of them have quite the temper but I have found a few of them to be quite endearing... although that could be because I gave them half my dinner. Again."
D_BestiaryData.Geothermal_Bat-Lore3: "You know what? AGENT was right, everyone hates Vespers..."
D_BestiaryData.Desert_Wolf-Lore3: "You think the wolves are bad? I had two of them Hyena things circling my base the other day. Howling is easy to ignore but the laughing? That just drives me MAD."
D_BestiaryData.Forest_Deer-Lore2: A black market for Icarus venison has been long suspected. While prospectors aren't supposed to remove any biological matter from the surface, rumors of Icarus meat and produce appearing on earth have been circulating. UDA INTSEC are currently investigating.
D_BestiaryData.Desert_Deer-Lore2: A black market for Icarus venison has been long suspected. While prospectors aren't supposed to remove any biological matter from the surface, rumors of Icarus meat and produce appearing on earth have been circulating. UDA INTSEC currently investigating.
D_BestiaryData.Swamp_Bird-Lore2: A genetic descendant of the Earth Flamingo, this creature has thrived since being introduced to Icarus. Instead of shrimp their colour is derived from the influence of nearby exotics.
D_BestiaryData.Needler-Lore1: A genetically mutated form of the Crocodile or Komodo. Its exact origins are unknown, but samples show earth species genetic markers.
D_BestiaryData.BatDog-Lore1: A genetically mutated form of the Eurasian wolf, cause of the genetic aberration is unknown. Its vampire bat like features lead to prospectors informally referring to the creature as Dracula, eventually shortened to Drac.
D_BestiaryData.Rockdog-Lore1: A large predator with a rock-like outer coating that protects it from most damage.
D_BestiaryData.Eagle-Lore1: A large, intelligent parrot, originally native to New Zealand. On Earth, the Kea population continues to steadily decline. Seeding on Icarus was seen as a way to keep the species alive. Genetically modified to handle harsher conditions.
D_BestiaryData.Kea-Lore1: A large, intelligent parrot, originally native to New Zealand. On Earth, the Kea population continues to steadily decline. Seeding on Icarus was seen as a way to keep the species alive. Genetically modified to handle harsher conditions.
D_BestiaryData.Landshark_Boss-Lore1: A larger sandworm that's been sighted occasionally in various environments. Displays a handful of unique physical and behavioral traits beyond what prospectors have experienced during other sandworm encounters.
D_BestiaryData.Tundra_Deer-Lore1: A medium-sized tundra herbivore, the Drosik grazes on sparse grasses and lichen while remaining highly alert to threats. Its single long horn curves backward over its head, seemingly more for display than defense. Extremely skittish, Drosik flee at the slightest disturbance, making them difficult to approach.
D_BestiaryData.Needler-Lore2: Able to move swiftly underwater and deep in mud; this predator keeps its prey at range while showering its target with organic bone-like spines.
D_BestiaryData.SandScuttler-Lore2: Adapted to extreme heat and toxic soil, Scuttlers evolved as opportunistic scavengers in environments where larger predators rarely linger. Their hardened carapace shields them from volcanic particulates, while their group-feeding behavior ensures they can rapidly strip a carcass before competition arrives. In high-activity zones, they're often the first sign that something recently died-sometimes very recently.
D_BestiaryData.Teenage_Caveworm-Lore1: Adolescent Sandworms that have outgrown the nest. Found all over Icarus, they spend most of their time deep underground.
D_BestiaryData.MiniHippo-Lore2: All Dribbo share beak-like mouth features, however some Exotic-affected creatures slowly developed an odd spiked protrusion. Research has shown that this is the egg that the creature hatches from, which they then continue to carry with them to maturity. In an early memo to Group 15 Dr Lee describes this Exotic mutation as "inevitable".
D_BestiaryData.Bear_Cub-Lore2: An unnamed UDA researcher made a failed attempt to tame Bear cubs from birth, in the hope that they could be used as mounts for prospectors travelling large distances. Needless to say, they did not succeed, or survive.
D_BestiaryData.Desert_Striker-Lore1: Arid Strikers are known for their extremely sharp claws, with an edge keen enough to gut a human in one blow, suit and all.
D_BestiaryData.Bee-Lore2: Bees were introduced to Icarus by the UDA in an attempt to boost local flora levels after the terraforming failed. Initially, they were deemed harmless and used by many prospectors as an easy source of food once a hive had been set up. However, the influence of exotics soon became apparent in their mutation from Earth insects into a far more dangerous Icarus variant.
D_BestiaryData.Rabbit_Variant-Lore1: Believed to be a mutation of the earth-like Rabbit, this creature is known for its uncanny ability to sense danger from a great distance.
D_BestiaryData.Tundra_Monkey-Lore2: Believed to be descendants of an introduced small mammal species, Gribblers adapted rapidly to the tundra's scarcity. Exotic exposure didn't make them bigger or braver - just stranger. Their sensory organs migrated beneath dense fur for insulation, and their jaws overdeveloped to deal with nutrient-poor diets. Radiation pockets in the region may account for their erratic behavior patterns and occasional, rudimentary ranged attacks.
D_BestiaryData.Swamp_Quadruped-Lore2: Believed to be endemic to Icarus, the Stryder seems purpose built for muddy terrain. They are timid creatures that will flee at the slightest provocation.
D_BestiaryData.RockGolem-Lore1: Believed to be native to Icarus, the Quarrite is a peculiar creature that upon first glance appears to be made of rocks. This is its armor which must first be removed in order to damage the creature. It can often be found in arid, rocky terrain which helps it to blend in with its surroundings.
D_BestiaryData.RockGolem_Juvenile-Lore1: Believed to be native to Icarus, the Quarrite is a peculiar creature that upon first glance appears to be made of rocks. This is its armor which must first be removed in order to damage the creature. It can often be found in arid, rocky terrain which helps it to blend in with its surroundings.
D_BestiaryData.Irradiated_Prospector-Lore2: Believed to be prospectors who lingered too long near unstable exotic deposits, Spectres are grim evidence of Icarus' mutagenic potential. The exotic matter fused with organic tissue, keeping the host animated long past viability. Whether driven by instinct, agony, or the pull of the exotics themselves remains unknown.
D_BestiaryData.Hopping_Creature-Lore2: Believed to descend from a terraforming pest-control species, Hoppers were originally meant to keep invasive insects in check. Exposure to exotic particulates in geothermal regions combined with radiation spikes in the swamplands accelerated their musculature and destabilized their equilibrium systems. The result is a creature that moves more like a spring-loaded trap than an animal, striking anything that enters its perceived "pounce radius."
D_BestiaryData.Hopping_Creature_Swamp-Lore2: Believed to descend from a terraforming pest-control species, Hoppers were originally meant to keep invasive insects in check. Exposure to exotic particulates in geothermal regions combined with radiation spikes in the swamplands accelerated their musculature and destabilized their equilibrium systems. The result is a creature that moves more like a spring-loaded trap than an animal, striking anything that enters its perceived "pounce radius."
D_BestiaryData.Stomper-Lore2: Believed to have descended from Earth's ratites, the Stomper's physiology shows clear exotic-radiation mutation - the heat-resistant feathers and shock-dampening tendons aren't natural. Logs suggest these birds were originally introduced for pest control, but prolonged exposure to volatile radiation pockets in the volcanic zone made them far meaner - and much harder to cook.
D_BestiaryData.DragonFly-Lore1: Bright-winged but mean-tempered, Venomflies hover at head height with a jittery, aggressive energy. Their limbs are built for gripping bark and exposed roots, and their oversized red eyes track movement with unnerving precision. While not large enough to be apex predators, they more than make up for it with painful stings and fast, darting flight patterns.
D_BestiaryData.Buffalo-Lore1: Buffalo are large, muscular mammals with shaggy brown fur and a distinctive hump on their shoulders. They have short, curved horns and a broad, flat face with a large, black nose.
D_BestiaryData.Buffalo-Lore2: Buffalo are social animals that can be tamed young by prospectors with a bit of patience. They spend much of their day grazing on grasses and other vegetation. They are also excellent swimmers and can cross rivers and other bodies of water.
D_BestiaryData.Cattle-Lore1: Cattle are hardy, domesticated herbivores renowned for their strength and adaptability, that thrive in grassy areas. Valued for their milk, meat, and labor, they are a cornerstone of agricultural life, providing sustenance and support to humans.
D_BestiaryData.Cattle-Lore2: Cattle are social animals and form strong bonds with other members of their herd. They even have best friends and can become stressed when separated from them. They also have excellent memories and can remember faces, locations, and even the people who treat them well or poorly.
D_BestiaryData.Chamios-Lore1: Chamois have a mix of deer and antelope qualities, and will flee at the first sign of a predator.
D_BestiaryData.Chamios-Lore2: Championed by a French sect of the UDA, the Chamois was introduced to Icarus to encourage diversity, and provide easy game for ill-prepared prospectors.
D_BestiaryData.Chicken-Lore1: Chickens may seem like an unlikely creature to exist on Icarus, but after their initial introduction, they have been found to thrive under the care of competent prospectors. They also have an uncanny ability to recognize humans, and hold grudges. Breeder beware!
D_BestiaryData.Chicken-Lore2: Chickens were introduced on Icarus as part of the Prospector Retention Program. Initially they were provided as a source of nourishment however early trials showed that many prospectors refused to use the animals as food, bonding with them in their solitude on the surface.
D_BestiaryData.Caveworm-Lore1: Commonly found in cave systems all across Icarus. This Infant Sandworm is believed to be the second stage of the Worm life cycle.
D_BestiaryData.Desert_Wolf-Lore2: Considered the pranksters of Icarus, these creatures are known to attack prospectors for no discernible reason and then laugh at their victims.
D_BestiaryData.Crocodile-Lore1: Crocodiles are large, carnivorous reptiles with a long, powerful tail and a broad, armored body. They have sharp teeth and a distinctive, elongated snout.
D_BestiaryData.Crocodile-Lore2: Crocodiles are solitary animals that spend much of their time basking in the sun or submerged in water. They are ambush predators that lie in wait for prey, which includes fish, birds, and mammals.
D_BestiaryData.Mange_Wolf-Lore2: DNA traces suggest they're the remnants of early canine stock, released to help control small wildlife during the first colonization phase. But radiation and exotic exposure rewrote them - nervous systems overclocked, aggression amplified, bone plating erupting where fur once grew. They thrive in areas most life avoids, drinking from runoff that would kill anything else within hours.
D_BestiaryData.Chamios_Variant-Lore1: Derived from the Capra family of goats on Earth, these herbivores are mostly pleasant-mannered and will flee from any noise or commotion.
D_BestiaryData.Chew-Lore2: Descended from Earth camels genetically modified for off-world colonization, Dravens were designed to survive extreme dehydration and radiation exposure. Over time, environmental adaptation on Icarus has thickened their hides and altered their physiology, making them far more resilient - and far less patient - than their ancestors.
D_BestiaryData.Drone-Lore2: Developed and fielded by the People's Syndicate, these drones reflect TPS's shift from protest and propaganda to direct action. Built from scavenged industrial components and repurposed military hardware, the drones embody the faction's philosophy: expendable machines fighting a war of ideas. Whether piloted by extremists or running preloaded combat routines, each unit exists solely to harass, disrupt, and remind the UDA that resistance is still airborne.
D_BestiaryData.Polar_Bear_Cub-Lore3: Do I wish I could keep one as a pet? Absolutely. Would it be likely to tear my face off in my sleep? Absolutely.
D_BestiaryData.Dog-Lore1: Dogs are loyal and beloved domesticated mammals known for their unwavering devotion and diverse breeds. With a keen sense of smell and boundless energy, these affectionate animals enrich the lives of humans as faithful companions and trusted helpers, embodying the timeless bond between humans and their four-legged friends back on Earth.
D_BestiaryData.Eagle-Lore2: Dr Amelia Tohu personally oversaw this project, having spent time raising Kea in conservation sectors as a young girl. Tohu was uncompromising in her commitment to propagating the species.
D_BestiaryData.Kea-Lore2: Dr Amelia Tohu personally oversaw this project, having spent time raising Kea in conservation sectors as a young girl. Tohu was uncompromising in her commitment to propagating the species.
D_BestiaryData.Chew-Lore1: Dravens are hardy, thick-skinned desert dwellers built to endure the scorching winds and blistering heat of Icarus's arid biomes. Their muscular bodies store both water and energy, allowing them to roam for days without rest. Normally docile, they can become aggressive when threatened - and their powerful legs make them dangerous foes up close.
D_BestiaryData.Gas_Flyer-Lore1: Drifters were affectionately named after the way they float through the air, much like a jellyfish moves through water on Earth. They are generally passive creatures but will retaliate if threatened.
D_BestiaryData.Arctic_Scorpion-Lore2: Due to Prospectors having an extreme aversion to dealing with these enlarged scorpions, this line of research had it's funding cut. Somewhat suspiciously, despite the project being canceled, a biological containment unit was discovered planet-side. Seeding the large scorpions on Icarus. Dr Lee is currently under investigation.
D_BestiaryData.Desert_Scorpion-Lore2: Due to Prospectors having an extreme aversion to dealing with these enlarged scorpions, this line of research had it's funding cut. Somewhat suspiciously, despite the project being canceled, a biological containment unit was discovered planet-side. Seeding the large scorpions on Icarus. Dr Lee is currently under investigation.
D_BestiaryData.Blueback-Lore2: Early results of study on the Blueback's call are captivating the scientific community. The call itself is a carrier wave of subsonic and hypersonic information. It seems to amplify aggression in any species with predatory instincts, and create a primal drive to follow the call. Group 15 are particularly interested in replicating this effect.
D_BestiaryData.Desert_Scorpion-Lore1: Experiment run by Dr Lee. The assumption 'Scorpions are just land lobster' was subject of much discussion. Dr Lee wanted to prove this fast reproducing, meaty arachnid, could be a source of food for prospectors in arid environments.
D_BestiaryData.Arctic_Scorpion-Lore1: Experiment run by Dr Lee. The assumption 'Scorpions are just land lobster' was subject of much discussion. Dr Lee wanted to prove this fast reproducing, meaty arachnid, could be a source of food for prospectors in colder environments.
D_BestiaryData.Spider-Lore2: Experimental arachnid gone wrong. A slightly larger arachnid was engineered to curb the spread of small endemic wildlife. Once introduced, environmental conditions and potentially exotic exposure caused this species to mutate. Avoid If possible.
D_BestiaryData.IceMammoth_WorldSpawn-Lore2: Extremist group TPS was responsible for the organisation of global protests against the revival of this species. While this study was not the most advanced genetics experiment, it became a pivotal reference in arguments against genetic augmentation. A slippery slope to experimentation on humans.
D_BestiaryData.Mammoth-Lore2: Extremist group TPS was responsible for the organisation of global protests against the revival of this species. While this study was not the most advanced genetics experiment, it became a pivotal reference in arguments against genetic augmentation. A slippery slope to experimentation on humans.
D_BestiaryData.Elephant-Lore2: Found In Arid environments, the African Elephant was genetically modified to make them less desirable to poachers. Alterations were made to the structure of their tusks causing them to degrade over time, when separated from the elephant. Effectively halting the ivory trade.
D_BestiaryData.Polar_Bear_Cub-Lore1: Found in colder parts of Icarus, these tiny versions of their parents are generally considered to be easy pickings for hungry predators... and prospectors.
D_BestiaryData.Arctic_Moa-Lore1: Found in icy terrazone environments. This previously extinct creature had many variants. Specifically found on Icarus is the Dinornis novaezealandiae, the second largest moa species in recorded history.
D_BestiaryData.Moa-Lore1: Found in moderate terrazone environments. This previously extinct creature had many variants. Specifically found on Icarus is the Dinornis novaezealandiae, the second largest moa species in recorded history.
D_BestiaryData.Tusker-Lore2: Found only in the coldest parts of the Terrazone, these creatures were discovered by an ACS scientist while setting up a forward base for weather monitoring. An avid storm chaser, their bravery led them to follow a family of Tuskers deep into the ice, documenting as much as they could before frostbite set in. A portion of the weather station was later converted into a ranch, where these animals are studied and tamed for use on longer prospects.
D_BestiaryData.Caveworm-Lore2: Freshly hatched, these larva like worms use Icarus cave systems as a relatively safe environment to grow. Scientists believe the mineral rich habitat contributes to this growth.
D_BestiaryData.Yeti-Lore1: Frostfoots are bulky, frost-coated omnivores roughly the size of an Earth Grizzly, but far more irritable. Their dense white fur insulates a muscular frame built for short, explosive bursts of speed, and the curved horns serve as both intimidation display and battering implement. Their name comes from their wide, heat-retentive paws, which allow them to traverse ice sheets without slipping - unfortunately, they also allow Frostfoots to stomp a prospector into the snow with unnerving stability.
D_BestiaryData.Ape-Lore2: Garganutans will often use their surroundings to their advantage in a fight. This is due to their chemically enlarged hippocampus. Because of their enhanced intellect, most prospectors will abandon any conflict or interaction with these creatures out of fear for their safety.
D_BestiaryData.Ape_Juvenile-Lore2: Garganutans will often use their surroundings to their advantage in a fight. This is due to their chemically enlarged hippocampus. Because of their enhanced intellect, most prospectors will abandon any conflict or interaction with these creatures out of fear for their safety.
D_BestiaryData.FleshSac_Floater-Lore1: Gaseous Floaters are buoyant, sack-like organisms that drift slowly through geothermal regions, suspended by internal gas pockets. Their swollen bodies are laced with volatile compounds, and any sudden impact-particularly contact with the ground-causes an immediate explosive rupture. While they move passively, their unpredictable descent paths make them an ever-present environmental hazard.
D_BestiaryData.Orka-Lore2: Genetic analysis suggests the Skulk originated from an early terraforming fauna program - possibly a hybrid between an armored boar and a tundra bear, later warped by long-term exposure to radiation-heavy exotics. The result is a cold-adapted apex scavenger, too stubborn to die and too mean to care.
D_BestiaryData.Giant_Roach-Lore2: Genetic markers indicate a hybridization of terrestrial roach and crustacean genomes, designed to thrive in high-humidity waste zones. Exposure to both exotics and radiation spurred unchecked growth and neurotoxin adaptation - their paralysis effect originally intended to subdue carrion for recycling. Left to breed unchecked, they've become slow-moving hazards, drifting through the mire like ambulatory traps.
D_BestiaryData.Slinker-Lore2: Genetic records suggest the Slinker originated from a hybridized predator species introduced during early terraforming trials. Adaptations to extreme cold (including heat-retentive fur and enhanced musculature) made it one of the few apex predators to thrive post-collapse. Attempts to contain the population have failed repeatedly.
D_BestiaryData.Snow_Wolf-Lore1: Genetically engineered Eurasian wolf, designed for a harsh and cold climate. The most common predator within terraformed environments.
D_BestiaryData.Forest_Wolf-Lore1: Genetically engineered Eurasian wolf, designed for various climates. Most common predator within terraformed environments.
D_BestiaryData.Alpha_Wolf_Boss-Lore1: Genetically engineered Eurasian wolf, the strongest of its species. Larger and more aggressive than the average wolf found on Icarus.
D_BestiaryData.Gas_Flyer-Lore2: Getting too close to this creature may cause them to attack, releasing a cloud of gas that acts similarly to a nerve agent. Some daring prospectors have taken to using this attack against other land-based creatures.
D_BestiaryData.Sandworm-Lore1: Giant worm-like creature native to Icarus. Partly to blame for the ubiquity of cave systems on the planet. Most common in arid areas - though it's theorized this creatures life cycle takes place over a variety of environments.
D_BestiaryData.Tundra_Monkey-Lore1: Gribblers are small, fur-covered omnivores that scuttle across the tundra with unnerving speed. Their forward-leaning gait and elongated forelimbs give them a hunched, almost primate-like profile, though whatever face they once had has collapsed into a puckered, tooth-studded maw. They scavenge more than they hunt, but desperation - or opportunity - can drive them into sudden melee scrambles. Some have developed the charming habit of lobbing whatever they can grab: ice chunks, bones, frozen filth... all fair game.
D_BestiaryData.Hammerhead_Slug-Lore2: Hammerheads employ an arsenal of tricks to capture their prey, the most prominent of which is a sticky, poisonous substance that they will spit or fling at an enemy. Survival rates against these creatures are fairly high, though unprepared prospectors may find themselves in a sticky situation.
D_BestiaryData.Alpha_Wolf_Boss-Lore2: Highly territorial, this species will not give up a hunt easily. Exhibits denning behavior, will often be found surrounded by it's pack.
D_BestiaryData.Horse_Standard-Lore1: Horses are large, herbivorous mammals renowned for their domestication and utility across various civilizations throughout history on Earth. Characterized by a robust body, a flowing mane, and a distinctive gallop, horses are esteemed for their strength, agility, and adaptability. Upon Icarus, they are a welcome and familiar sight in a place of peril.
D_BestiaryData.Horse_Standard-Lore2: Horses were introducted to Icarus as part of the Contractor Companion Program, which was an attempt to encourage Prospectors to stay on Icarus for longer stretches and reduce the overall turnover rate by the UDA. It was fairly successful, and many contractors who received a Horse as part of the program chose to keep them at its conclusion. However, those who lost their companions in planetside accidents were more likely to leave Icarus for good, citing severe emotional distress in their exit interviews.
D_BestiaryData.Baby_Deer-Lore1: Infant deer, commonly seen following their parent through the Icarus wilderness. Has been known to follow other creatures if it's parent dies.
D_BestiaryData.Horse-Lore2: Initial reports on Terrenus development showed concern regarding their ability to be trained for use on time-sensitive drops, where Contractors needed a reliable source of swift transportation. The first batch released into the terrazone disappeared within 72 hours, costing Sinotai a small fortune in lost revenue. The following group were fixed with tracking beacons, and a somewhat controversial device to keep them within a set radius of their designated work zone.
D_BestiaryData.Flightless_Tank-Lore2: Introduced as part of early terraforming experiments, Sandhorns were meant to stabilize shifting dunes and aerate soil as they grazed. Exotics interacted with their mineral-rich diet, reinforcing their shells into near-geologic hardness. Over time this made them incredibly resilient but also incredibly stubborn, a combination that made Group 15 relocation efforts... brief.
D_BestiaryData.Cat-Lore2: Introduced as part of the Contractor Companion Program, these cats were chosen for their bonding abilities and drive to hunt. Unfortunately, after the first round of trials, it was discovered that the cryo-sleep had destroyed the latter, resulting in some exceptionally lazy cats. However, most contractors reported that they didn't mind this and were horrified when asked if they'd prefer a replacement.
D_BestiaryData.Dog-Lore2: Introduced as part of the Contractor Companion Program, these dogs were chosen for their bonding abilities with humans. Icarus is known to be a harsh and unforgiving environment, where loneliness can set in quickly. These dogs were frozen in cryo-sleep and transported planetside where they were allocated to select contractors for preliminary trials. These were wildly successful, with many contractors refusing to return the animals at the end of the testing phase.
D_BestiaryData.Bounder_Desert-Lore2: Introduced to desert zones as part of early terraforming efforts, Korrin have thrived in harsh, open environments. Some isolated populations show minor mutations from prolonged exposure to exotics, enhancing their sensory organs for survival in the heat and sandstorms.
D_BestiaryData.Bear-Lore2: Introduced to maintain reasonable levels of herbivore fauna.  While originally engineered to be more passive unless food motivated, the Bear consistently displays levels of increased aggression towards prospectors. The UDA is not liable for missing appendages, limbs or crewmates.
D_BestiaryData.Tundra_Deer-Lore2: Introduced to tundra regions by early scientists as a grazing species, the Drosik has since adapted to the harsh conditions on-planet. Some populations show subtle mutations from prolonged exposure to exotics, slightly increasing horn length and herd vigilance.
D_BestiaryData.Deer_Variant-Lore2: It is believed that the Equix is a mix of deer and earth antelope DNA, but the exact details are closely guarded by the UDA.
D_BestiaryData.Wooly_Zebra-Lore2: It is theorised that this herd of Zebra quietly migrated into an unsupervised part of Icarus and were heavily affected by the surrounding exotic matter.  The team who stumbled across them on a recon mission of the area took several weeks to recover from the shock.
D_BestiaryData.Teenage_Caveworm-Lore2: It's theorized - due to the relative prevalence of adolescents and the significantly smaller numbers of fully grown worms, that many do not live past this stage.
D_BestiaryData.Jaguar-Lore2: Jaguars are solitary and territorial animals that are primarily active at dawn and dusk. They are skilled hunters and prey on a variety of animals, including chamois, deer, and nosy prospectors.. no matter how much of a 'cat person' they may be.
D_BestiaryData.Kiwi-Lore1: Kiwis are flightless birds native to New Zealand on Earth. They are characterized by their small size, round body, long beak, and distinctive nocturnal habits. With highly developed senses of smell and touch, they forage for various insects and fruits under the cover of darkness. On Earth, Kiwis play a crucial ecological role as seed dispersers, contributing to the health and diversity of their ecosystems. It was hoped that they would do the same on Icarus after the terraforming failed to spread various plants across the face of the planet.
D_BestiaryData.Kiwi-Lore2: Kiwis were introduced to Icarus to help diversify the plant life in their habitats. They were hunted almost to extinction back on Earth, as they are mostly unable to defend themselves from predators. It is thought that they will likely suffer a similar fate on Icarus, though scientists remain hopeful that the influence of Exotics may trigger the formation of a stronger survival instinct in these birds; only time will tell.
D_BestiaryData.Komodo-Lore1: Komodo dragons are large, carnivorous reptiles with a long, powerful tail and a rough, scaly skin. They have sharp, curved teeth and a forked tongue.
D_BestiaryData.Komodo-Lore2: Komodo dragons are solitary animals that are active during the day. They are ambush predators that hunt prey such as deer, boar, and buffalo. They are also known to scavenge carrion.
D_BestiaryData.Mange_Wolf-Lore1: Lean and feral, Skulmutts prowl the irradiated wastes in packs, their skin thinned and split until the bone of their skulls gleams through like pale armor. Their movements are twitchy and erratic - fast when they strike, faster when they flee - and their howls have a warped, metallic timbre that echoes across dead valleys. They show signs of pack coordination and uncanny intelligence, often circling prey into open ground before attacking from multiple angles.
D_BestiaryData.Irradiated_Abomination-Lore2: Like Spectres and Wraiths, Revenants originate from human bodies saturated with exotic particulate-but only in areas where radiation amplifies exotic reactivity to catastrophic levels. Instead of cellular failure, the combination forces continuous mutation. Most afflicted die long before reaching this stage, but a rare few survive long enough for the process to accelerate unchecked. Revenants are found exclusively in the most unstable radioactive zones, drawn to exotic concentrations they can no longer live without.
D_BestiaryData.Hopping_Creature-Lore1: Low-slung and wide-framed, Hoppers move in a series of explosive bounds that make them hard to track and even harder to avoid. Their wing-like forelimbs don't grant true flight, but they act as stabilizers and shock absorbers when landing, letting the creature ricochet across swamp muck or volcanic scree with unsettling agility. Small but vicious, they favor ambushes - launching themselves straight at a target's torso or face.
D_BestiaryData.Hopping_Creature_Swamp-Lore1: Low-slung and wide-framed, Hoppers move in a series of explosive bounds that make them hard to track and even harder to avoid. Their wing-like forelimbs don't grant true flight, but they act as stabilizers and shock absorbers when landing, letting the creature ricochet across swamp muck or volcanic scree with unsettling agility. Small but vicious, they favor ambushes - launching themselves straight at a target's torso or face.
D_BestiaryData.Cougar-Lore2: Much like deer antlers on Earth, experienced prospectors like to show off mounted Cougar heads as a sign of their hunting and survival abilities.
D_BestiaryData.Predator_Bird-Lore2: Often mistaken for the relatively harmless Kea, the Dreadwing's hunting behaviour more closely resembles that of the Australian Magpie, it utilizes swift diving to attack its unfortunate prey.
D_BestiaryData.Desert_Deer-Lore1: On Icarus, Antelope make up the most abundant population of herbivores along with their deer cousins. Typically, they can be found in family groups of three or more. As they are sizable and fleet-footed creatures, they are prone to getting spooked easily and are adept at camouflaging themselves in the desert.
D_BestiaryData.Forest_Deer-Lore1: On Icarus, deer make up the most abundant population of herbivores. Typically, they can be found in family groups of three or more. As they are sizable and fleet-footed creatures, they are prone to getting spooked easily and are adept at camouflaging themselves in the forest.
D_BestiaryData.Roat-Lore1: One of the first creatures to be discovered outside the Earth-like Terrazone, the Roat is a small creature that is heavily adapted to its environment. Their temperament can change rapidly, catching many contractors off guard.
D_BestiaryData.SulfurWorm-Lore2: Originally adapted to subsistence in sulfuric aquifers, these worms underwent drastic changes in geothermal regions where exotics accumulate underground. The combination of extreme heat, toxic chemistry, and radiation accelerated their growth patterns and converted their natural defensive secretions into hyper-adhesive projectiles. The mutation also heightened their territorial instincts - anything approaching their pools is treated as a threat.
D_BestiaryData.Raptor-Lore2: Originally bred as a terraforming control species to manage invasive herbivores, the Raptor adapted rapidly to the planet's extremes. Desert variants developed lighter hides and heat-resistant scales, while geothermal strains evolved thicker skin and increased aggression. Prospectors have since discovered ways to tame and ride them-at considerable risk.
D_BestiaryData.Raptor_Desert-Lore2: Originally bred as a terraforming control species to manage invasive herbivores, the Raptor adapted rapidly to the planet's extremes. Desert variants developed lighter hides and heat-resistant scales, while geothermal strains evolved thicker skin and increased aggression. Prospectors have since discovered ways to tame and ride them-at considerable risk.
D_BestiaryData.DragonFly-Lore2: Originally engineered as a pollinator species for wetland reclamation, Venomflies were meant to resist swampborne parasites and fungal rot. Post-collapse radiation surges interacting with exotic particulate triggered hyper-territorial behavior and an overproduction of neurotoxic venom. Their nests - usually clustered in hollowed logs or dense root tangles - are treated as sacred ground, and even minor vibrations can provoke a swarm response.
D_BestiaryData.Yeti-Lore2: Originally introduced by Norex as a hardy cold-biome work animal prototype, Frostfoots adapted too well. Prolonged exposure to exotic-laced permafrost altered their metabolism, increasing aggression and muscle density beyond what handlers could safely manage. After several "containment failures" (read: they tore down the fences and ate the researchers), the program was quietly abandoned. The animals thrived without supervision, much to everyone else's dismay.
D_BestiaryData.Polar_Bear_Cub-Lore2: Polar bear cubs are born blind and deaf, making them heavily dependent on their mothers for the first few months of life.
D_BestiaryData.Polar_Bear-Lore1: Polar bears can be found in colder areas of the Terrazone. Originally seeded to promote biodiversity in the Icarus food chain. Due to their increased aggression and predatory instincts they quickly wiped out the seal population.
D_BestiaryData.Pronghorn-Lore2: Pronghorns are incredibly fast runners, which makes them difficult prey for predators. They also have excellent eyesight and can detect movement miles away. However, they are not as agile as other animals, which can make them vulnerable to predators in certain situations.
D_BestiaryData.Pronghorn-Lore1: Pronghorns were originally introduced to Icarus to add variety to the population and give prospectors a good challenge at target practice.
D_BestiaryData.Roat-Lore2: Prospectors have been warned by the UDA not to feed the Roats, although it is suspected that many ignore this warning. Much like seagulls on Earth, Roats can get quite aggressive when food is involved.
D_BestiaryData.RockGolem-Lore2: Quarrites have a rather remarkable skill which consists of consuming entire mineral deposits to strengthen and replenish their armor-like coating. They then use this armor to trample or roll over their prey, to great effect.
D_BestiaryData.RockGolem_Juvenile-Lore2: Quarrites have a rather remarkable skill which consists of consuming entire mineral deposits to strengthen and replenish their armor-like coating. They then use this armor to trample or roll over their prey, to great effect.
D_BestiaryData.Flying_Tank-Lore1: Ravagers are massive, volcanic-dwelling arthropods that resemble boulders until they decide otherwise. Curled tight, they pass for part of the terrain - a convenient heat sink basking in lava vents. When disturbed, the creature unfurls with startling speed, revealing powerful wings and a mouth built to crack stone.
D_BestiaryData.Irradiated_Abomination-Lore1: Revenants represent the final stage of human-afflicted radiation-exotic toxicity-an escalation far beyond Spectres and Wraiths. Barely recognizable as once-human, these creatures have grown massive under prolonged exposure to radioactive exotic concentrations. Their elongated limbs, hardened growths, and erratic movement patterns make them unpredictable and extremely dangerous. Revenants exhibit heightened aggression and resilience, capable of withstanding significant damage while delivering devastating melee attacks with irradiated claws.
D_BestiaryData.IceMammoth_WorldSpawn-Lore1: Revived ancient earth species. A well preserved sample was found deep in the Le Brea tar pits, the first few mammoths were carried by elephants as surrogate mothers. Due to significant debate on the ethics of the mammoths revival, the experiment had to be conducted on Icarus.
D_BestiaryData.Mammoth-Lore1: Revived ancient earth species. A well preserved sample was found deep in the Le Brea tar pits, the first few mammoths were carried by elephants as surrogate mothers. Due to significant debate on the ethics of the mammoths revival, the experiment had to be conducted on Icarus.
D_BestiaryData.IceMammoth-Lore2: Rimetusks are incredibly strong, with thick ice-like armor covering their vulnerable areas. They live in harmony with flying creatures and will often summon them to help in a fight. Their stomp is a powerful attack that should always be avoided if you want to walk away with your life.
D_BestiaryData.Chamios_Variant-Lore2: Sadly when introduced to Icarus scientists noticed too late that this species has a habit of getting stuck in awkward places. Unlike their mountain goat bretheren back on Earth, the Chala tend to climb or explore and then accept their fate.
D_BestiaryData.Flightless_Tank-Lore1: Sandhorns are towering, slow-moving desert leviathans whose shells look more like eroded mesas than living armor. Their massive front horn is used primarily for shoving aside boulders and uprooting scrub, but it becomes a devastating weapon if provoked. Despite their size, Sandhorns are herbivores with calm dispositions - provided you don't startle them, corner them, or sneeze too loudly within a five-meter radius.
D_BestiaryData.Sandwyrm_Queen-Lore1: Sandwyrm Queens are colossal, airborne predators that dominate the deep desert and represent the final stage of the sandworm life cycle. Their immense size is substantial enough to interfere with satellite signals, and their armored exoskeleton shrugs off most conventional weapons. As matriarchs, they are responsible for laying clutches of eggs that eventually hatch into the sandworms that burrow unseen beneath the dunes. Highly territorial and violently aggressive, a Queen will respond to any perceived threat with overwhelming force. Despite their near-impenetrable hide, the cranial region and mouth cavity remain the only reliable vulnerabilities.
D_BestiaryData.SandScuttler-Lore1: Scuttlers are small, scarab-like arthropods common in volcanic biomes, typically found clustering around carcasses. Although passive at first, they display a wary vigilance-remaining still and observing anyone who comes near. Once a threat moves off, they swarm the corpse in quick, coordinated bursts. If a prospector lingers too long or interferes directly, Scuttlers will abandon their usual caution and attack with surprising ferocity for their size.
D_BestiaryData.Bounder_Desert-Lore1: Small, deer-like herbivore adapted to desert survival. Korrin have unusually large ears and eyes, likely for detecting predators and regulating body temperature in open terrain. A tiny snout hints at selective grazing on sparse desert vegetation. Extremely flighty, Korrin will bolt at the slightest hint of danger.
D_BestiaryData.Snow_Leopard-Lore1: Snow leopards are large, muscular cats with thick, white fur that helps them blend into their snowy mountain habitat. They have distinctive black spots and rosettes on their fur, and their long, bushy tail provides balance and warmth in cold temperatures.
D_BestiaryData.Snow_Leopard-Lore2: Snow leopards are solitary animals. They are highly adapted to their mountain habitat and are able to climb steep, rocky terrain with ease. They are also skilled hunters and prey on a variety of animals, but are often killed for their valuable fur.
D_BestiaryData.Irradiated_Prospector-Lore1: Spectres tend to wander radioactive zones, their body warped and decayed by prolonged exposure to exotic contamination. Once human, these figures now move with jerky, unnatural precision, glowing faintly in the dark with residual energy. Their claws and distorted limbs make close encounters lethal, and radiation levels spike wherever they roam.
D_BestiaryData.Snow_Striker-Lore2: Stalkers are regarded as one of the more, if not the most frightening creatures found on Icarus. While there are larger, more aggressive creatures, the stalker is intelligent. Living up to their name, Prospectors report being followed for hours - days even, the stalker biding  its time to strike. Ambush behavior is common, it's highly recommended to request help when dealing with these creatures.
D_BestiaryData.Stomper-Lore1: Standing tall on wiry legs and crowned with bright plumage, the Stomper is an elegant creature. Its oversized talons and reinforced leg bones make it deceptively powerful, capable of breaking stone or skulls with a single strike. Normally, the Stomper wanders volcanic plains in small herds, pecking through ash for mineral-rich roots and insects. When threatened, though, it unleashes thunderous stomps that can crack stone.
D_BestiaryData.Orka-Lore1: Stocky, low to the ground, and armored with jagged dorsal spines, the Skulk is a predator built for ambush in the frozen wastes. Its dense, muscle-packed frame lets it plow through snowdrifts with surprising speed, while its thick hide shrugs off most projectiles. It hunts by sound and vibration, often lurking beneath snow until prey strays too close - then erupting upward in a flurry of claws and teeth.
D_BestiaryData.Rockdog-Lore2: Stonejaw were one of the first subspecies to be discovered on Icarus as a result of exotic mutation. Scientists have yet to confirm if its bite has been enhanced with venom due to contractors being eaten before they have the chance to inspect their wounds.
D_BestiaryData.Storca-Lore1: Storcas are mid-sized predators native to the tundra, built for agility and endurance in low-visibility conditions. Their lightweight frames, long limbs, and heat-sensing cranial organs allow them to navigate blizzards and frozen terrain without relying on sight. Though cautious and often aggressive toward intruders, Storcas show surprisingly social behavior among their own kind and can be playful in groups, especially when not threatened. With careful training, they can even be domesticated as companions.
D_BestiaryData.Storca-Lore2: Storcas developed in regions where extreme cold and diffuse exotic exposure disrupted typical sensory evolution. Over generations, reliance on vision diminished, replaced by more specialized detection systems tuned to vibration, heat, and atmospheric shifts. Their cooperative tendencies likely evolved as a survival advantage in harsh, resource-scarce environments.
D_BestiaryData.Geothermal_Bat-Lore1: Sulfur Vespers are bat-like aerial pests commonly found in geothermal regions, nesting around vents, caves, and unstable rock formations. They are highly aggressive and will swarm anything that enters their territory, relying on rapid flight and repeated dive attacks. While individually fragile, their numbers and erratic movement make them a constant hazard in certain zones.
D_BestiaryData.SulfurWorm-Lore1: Sulfur Worms are colossal burrowing invertebrates that lurk beneath the crust of geothermal basins, using sulfur pools as both camouflage and incubator. Most of their bulk stays submerged, but when prey wanders too close, they surge upward in a violent eruption of steam and acid vapors. Their primary attack is projecting sticky, sulfur-rich globs that are best avoided.
D_BestiaryData.Geothermal_Spider-Lore1: Sulfuric Spiders are large arachnids native to geothermal regions, commonly found near sulfur vents and unstable ground. Their thick, heat-resistant exoskeleton protects them from corrosive gases, while elongated legs allow them to navigate fissures and uneven terrain with ease. Highly aggressive, they will defend their territory on sight, using venomous bites and rapid strikes to overwhelm intruders.
D_BestiaryData.Drone-Lore1: TPS Drones are armed aerial units deployed across contested regions, operating with a mix of autonomous systems and remote piloting. Designed for relentless engagement, they pursue targets until destroyed, showing no capacity for retreat or self-preservation. Their constant movement, precision fire, and ability to reposition quickly make them a persistent threat, especially in open terrain.
D_BestiaryData.Arctic_Bat-Lore1: The Arctic Bat is a flying mammal adapted to life in freezing environments. These agile creatures navigate through vast cave systems with impressive echolocation abilities, preying on anything they can find in the cavernous darkness.
D_BestiaryData.Desert_Striker-Lore2: The Arid Striker is one of the reasons the UDA implemented the controversial 'buddy' system. Prospectors with enough spare cash could choose a teammate to drop down with, in order to spot each other through Striker territory. The costs for this were astronomical, and the program was quickly scrapped.
D_BestiaryData.Bee-Lore1: The Bees of Icarus are known for their long, needle-like stingers which are capable of piercing even the toughest of envirosuits. Proceed with caution. Despite the danger, they are still a reasonable source of food for many contractors living long-term on-planet.
D_BestiaryData.Blueback-Lore1: The Blueback is an Icarus native, while mostly docile it will defend itself when provoked. Displays a symbiotic relationship with local and introduced fauna. When injured it will retreat into its shell, calling on the help of nearby predatory wildlife.
D_BestiaryData.Cave_Bat-Lore1: The Cave Bat is a flying mammal adapted to life in subterranean environments. Sporting sleek, dark fur for camouflage, these agile creatures navigate through vast cave systems with impressive echolocation abilities, preying on anything they can find in the cavernous darkness.
D_BestiaryData.BatDog-Lore2: The Drac has lost many of its wolf like traits. Its enlarged teeth and jaw musculature are a serious threat. It will occasionally howl to call for help when hunting. Due to an infrared reflecting film on the surface of their eyes, at a distance they can be seen glowing red.
D_BestiaryData.Deer_Variant-Lore1: The Equix can be found in areas of Icarus with many different climates, it adapts to its surroundings swiftly and efficiently.
D_BestiaryData.Ape-Lore1: The Garganutan is the direct result of unsanctioned experimentation conducted on the surface of Icarus. Researchers were trying to gather data on the effect of exotics on the brain, and whether it could increase the capability of some animals to learn faster, or to a greater extent.
D_BestiaryData.Ape_Juvenile-Lore1: The Garganutan is the direct result of unsanctioned experimentation conducted on the surface of Icarus. Researchers were trying to gather data on the effect of exotics on the brain, and whether it could increase the capability of some animals to learn faster, or to a greater extent.
D_BestiaryData.Hammerhead_Slug-Lore1: The Hammerhead is believed to be an Icarus native, mainly found in the Prometheus region. They can be deceptively hard to kill, due to their tendency to split into smaller lifeforms to overwhelm their prey.
D_BestiaryData.Lava_Slug-Lore2: The Ignari is generally harmless but can be highly territorial. They tend to leave slime trails around their territory. They have also been known to leave trails around man-made structures, this has resulted in a handful of contractors being evacuated to orbit with life-threatening injuries after accidentally stepping onto a trail.
D_BestiaryData.Rabbit_Variant-Lore2: The Pygmy Lop is another creature that the UDA has released a warning for, as studies have shown that they cannot be tamed or kept as a pet.
D_BestiaryData.Raptor-Lore1: The Raptor is a swift, bipedal predator found across the desert and geothermal biomes. Built for speed and endurance, it uses powerful legs and curved talons to bring down prey with precision strikes. Despite its size, it moves with surprising agility, making it one of the deadliest hunters on Icarus.
D_BestiaryData.Raptor_Desert-Lore1: The Raptor is a swift, bipedal predator found across the desert and geothermal biomes. Built for speed and endurance, it uses powerful legs and curved talons to bring down prey with precision strikes. Despite its size, it moves with surprising agility, making it one of the deadliest hunters on Icarus.
D_BestiaryData.Lava_Blueback-Lore1: The Redback is an Icarus native, evolved for volcanic environments. While mostly docile it will defend itself when provoked. Displays a symbiotic relationship with local and introduced fauna. When injured it will retreat into its shell, calling on the help of nearby predatory wildlife. Believed to be a distant cousin of the Blueback.
D_BestiaryData.IceMammoth-Lore1: The Rimetusk is an example of what happens when scientific protocol is ignored. An apprentice of Dr Lee (his whereabouts currently unknown) was tasked with researching chemical interactions with local flora and fauna within the Prometheus region. He instead chose to conduct his own enzyme research. This did not end well for him, or his team.
D_BestiaryData.Sandworm-Lore2: The Sandworm has been a focus of a plethora of studies. The UDA see these worms as a source of non-terrestrial biological technology. Chief Geneticist Dr Amelia Tohu has been tasked with gathering more information on the species.
D_BestiaryData.Slinker-Lore1: The Slinker prowls the tundra biome, its sleek frame and low stance built for silent pursuit across frozen plains. Its deep blue coat and faint stripes make it nearly invisible in twilight, striking fast from cover. Highly aggressive, it hunts alone, preferring ambush tactics over drawn-out chases.
D_BestiaryData.Snow_Striker-Lore1: The Stalker has a strong pack mentality, oriented around small family groups. The only creature native to Icarus to show such intense bonds. It's strong, agile and smart. The perfect hunter.
D_BestiaryData.Horse-Lore1: The Terrenus is an engineered descendant of Earth's horses.  Its compact, sturdy build allows for swift movement through most areas. Sinotai came to find that genetic splicing with Eurasian wild boar resulted in significantly heightened endurance in these creatures. Unlike their predecessors, the Terrenus is less likely to flee a predator - using its tusks to defend themselves and their kin.
D_BestiaryData.Tusker-Lore1: The Tusker's four eyes help them to detect threats at a far greater accuracy than similar earth-like creatures such as the Bison. Capable of fighting off aggressive wildlife, the Tusker's increased stamina and deadly protrusions make it a strong choice for prospectors looking for a companion in the harsh wilderness of Icarus.
D_BestiaryData.Snow_Slug-Lore1: The UDA regrets to inform you that there is minimal research available on this creature. It appears to be the result of prohibited experimentation by an illegal branch of the company Norex- [REDACTED]
D_BestiaryData.Swamp_Slug-Lore2: The Viscid is generally harmless but can be highly territorial. They tend to leave slime trails around their territory; favouring large bodies of water. They have also been known to leave trails around man-made structures, this has resulted in a handful of contractors being evacuated to orbit with life-threatening injuries after accidentally stepping onto a trail.
D_BestiaryData.Cougar-Lore1: The cougar subspecies was brought in to control the population of smaller mammals and adapted quickly to the arid regions of Icarus.
D_BestiaryData.Swamp_Bird-Lore1: The genetics team didn't quite get the size of the Ubis right, but as these creatures can be tamed (with some difficulty), many prospectors are more than happy about the mistake.
D_BestiaryData.Sheep-Lore1: The humble Sheep is a mostly peaceful herbivore characterized by its thick fleece, providing insulation against the ever-changing weather of Icarus. Though larger and more robust than Earthen sheep, it retains the gentle demeanor and affinity for grazing common to its kind. Contractors may find solace in their presence, as their wool offers warmth and comfort amidst the harsh expanse of its habitat.
D_BestiaryData.Jaguar-Lore1: The jaguar was introduced to regulate the population of smaller mammals and quickly adapted to forest and wooded areas in the terraformed zones of Icarus.
D_BestiaryData.MiniHippo-Lore1: The result of another of Dr Lee's unsanctioned experiments, the Dribbo as it's been named by prospectors has become somewhat of an example of when science goes too far. Illegal genetic splicing of Earth hippo DNA and Icarus native DNA resulted in these curious-looking creatures. Once released planetside they were quick to reproduce, but the influence of Exotics quickly mutated some offspring.
D_BestiaryData.Scorpion_Boss-Lore1: The result of engineered scorpions being accidentally released on Icarus. It's likely exposure to environmental conditions in addition to exotic material that caused extreme genetic mutation.
D_BestiaryData.GhostCrocodile-Lore2: The species evolved around shifting dune basins where visibility and stability are unreliable. Over time, reliance on conventional senses diminished as they adapted instead to read pressure waves, heat gradients, and ground resonance. Their dense armor and elongated snout reflect a lifestyle built around brief, violent bursts from the substrate-ideally before prey even knows they're there.
D_BestiaryData.Lava_Komodo-Lore2: The thick hide of the Ashen Drake works to protect it from the searing heat of the ground it walks on, along with providing excellent defense from other predators.
D_BestiaryData.Landshark_Boss-Lore2: There have been multiple reports of this creature appearing during induced seismic events associated with terraforming. This creature may be another stage in the worm life cycle, it's rarity has made it difficulty to study.  The UDA is currently forming various kill and capture strike teams.
D_BestiaryData.Rabbit-Lore2: These are social animals that live in groups called herds,  spending much of their time foraging for food in the snow. They are herbivores and feed on a variety of plants.
D_BestiaryData.Predator_Bird-Lore1: These birds can be found in the most inhospitable areas of Icarus. They feed on other creatures and are highly aggresive, making them disliked by contractors working in their territory.
D_BestiaryData.Cat-Lore1: These cats are felines that have been cryogenically preserved, their sleek fur untouched by their time spent in space. Emerging from stasis, they retain their natural grace and keen senses, navigating their new home with a sense of curiosity and playfulness.
D_BestiaryData.Geothermal_Bat-Lore2: These creatures are believed to have evolved from small flying mammals that adapted to geothermal environments. Prolonged exposure to sulfur gases altered their respiratory systems and heightened their aggression, allowing them to thrive where few predators can follow. Their rapid breeding cycles ensure infestations form quickly if left unchecked.
D_BestiaryData.Lava_Blueback-Lore2: These creatures are well known for their distinctive calls, which are believed to be able to manipulate other creatures. This does include humans, as many prospectors have taken to defending Redbacks and keeping them as pets.
D_BestiaryData.Lava_Komodo-Lore1: These creatures have developed a remarkable resistance to the harsh heat and toxic environments of the most hostile parts of Icarus.
D_BestiaryData.Reaver-Lore2: These creatures have poor vision but a keen sense of hearing, and are almost impossible to kill while submerged. Some prospectors have taken to leaving an animal corpse nearby to lure them into the open in order to run to safety or to finally finish them off.
D_BestiaryData.Lava_Hunter_Spawns-Lore2: These creatures tend to work as a swarm to attack threats; flying, biting and generally wearing down their enemies over time.
D_BestiaryData.Lava_Hunter-Lore2: These creatures were first discovered by a Group 15 scientist posted at the only volcanic station on Icarus. After a tiring day of exploration and surveying it is believed they strayed off course on the return to their base. They managed to send a blurry and frantic stream to Group 15 HQ before the feed was abruptly cut off. Their body was never found.
D_BestiaryData.Bear_Cub-Lore1: These cubs are usually found in the forest and wooded areas of Icarus, guarded by their often easily-provoked mothers.
D_BestiaryData.Swamp_Slug-Lore1: These gentle creatures are often found in swampy parts of Icarus, and are easily frightened by loud noises and disturbances in their vicinity. In most instances they will flee from humans.
D_BestiaryData.Lava_Slug-Lore1: These gentle creatures are often found in the hotter parts of Icarus, and are easily frightened by loud noises and disturbances in their vicinity. In most instances they will flee from humans.
D_BestiaryData.Spider-Lore1: These giant arachnids were a botched pet project of Dr Lee. Geneticist and Arachnologist. Lee was repeatedly warned that many prospectors displayed an unwillingness to interact with the new species. The Doctor would adamantly reply "But look at the little floofy nope feets". Lee was not very popular.
D_BestiaryData.Flying_Tank-Lore2: These giants trace back to reinforced mining-support organisms originally developed to clear debris in extreme temperatures. In volcanic biomes saturated with exotic particulates and radiation, their physiology pushed into overdrive: chitin hardened into near-ceramic shielding, musculature expanded, and dormant flight structures became fully functional.
D_BestiaryData.Desert_Wolf-Lore1: These medium-sized carnivores have distinctive spotted fur and powerful jaws. They are often thought of as scavengers but they are also skilled hunters.
D_BestiaryData.Wooly_Zebra-Lore1: These odd-looking creatures are believed to be a mutation directly resulting from the work done in Group 15 labs to integrate the genetically engineered Zebra into the Icarus food chain.
D_BestiaryData.FleshSac_Floater-Lore2: These organisms are believed to have evolved around geothermal vents where toxic gases are abundant. Over time, their internal structures adapted to store and metabolize volatile compounds for buoyancy, with explosive decomposition becoming an unintended side effect. Exotic exposure appears minimal; their danger comes not from mutation, but from extreme environmental specialization.
D_BestiaryData.Lava_Hunter_Spawns-Lore1: These smaller specimens are the direct offspring of Lava Hunters, with tough skin that is incredibly resistant to heat.
D_BestiaryData.Geothermal_Spider-Lore2: These spiders evolved in environments saturated with sulfur and extreme heat, where only highly specialized life could persist. Long-term exposure to geothermal gases altered the composition of their venom, making it highly corrosive and fast-acting. Unlike many Icarus creatures, Sulfuric Spiders show little evidence of exotic-driven mutation, suggesting adaptation rather than interference is responsible for their resilience.
