D_BestiaryData.Rabbit-Lore1: They have large, furry feet that provide traction on icy surfaces, and long, floppy ears that help regulate their body temperature. They are very vulnerable to predators, and easily startled.
D_BestiaryData.Sheep-Lore2: This breed of Sheep was initially sourced from genetic material of animals from New Zealand. Known for its large Sheep population and wide, expansive farmland, New Zealand was considered the planet's best site from which to draw from. Most contractors report that they are easy to work with, and show minimal signs of temper. Though depending on the weather, reports do show that they can be a bit stubborn.
D_BestiaryData.Reaver-Lore1: This creature is often hard to spot in its swampy habitat as it spends most of its time submerged. This gives it the element of surprise which has unfortunately resulted in much missing data from researchers sent out into the field.
D_BestiaryData.Arctic_Moa-Lore2: This large flightless bird is the result of genetic experimentation, preserved Moa DNA was found in amber near Tekapo, New Zealand. This was used to revive the extinct species.
D_BestiaryData.Moa-Lore2: This large flightless bird is the result of genetic experimentation, preserved Moa DNA was found in amber near Tekapo, New Zealand. This was used to revive the extinct species.
D_BestiaryData.Lava_Hunter-Lore1: This mysterious creature is mainly known for its size and the speed of its attack. Rumours abound in regards to its origins though many prospectors consider them to be the guardians of Prometheus and stay well away from their nests.
D_BestiaryData.Zebra-Lore2: This particular breed of Zebra are the direct result of the UDA engineering labs. Sample tissue has shown evidence of significant genetic divergence. It's theorized that continued exposure to exotic matter and/or terraforming enzymes may result in severe mutation.
D_BestiaryData.Elephant-Lore1: This species was hunted to near-extinction on earth. and was introduced to Icarus as a means of regenerating their population.
D_BestiaryData.Snow_Slug-Lore2: This subspecies of Viscid has been observed to attack using frost and seems to be quite resistant to fire. The mutation facilitated by [REDACTED] has increased its strength and gene- [The remainder of this report is illegible and covered in slime]
D_BestiaryData.Giant_Roach-Lore1: Towering, skeletal insects that move like nightmares on stilts. Clickers stalk the swamp shallows in eerie silence, their translucent limbs swaying with each step. Long tendrils hang from their segmented underbellies, trailing through the air - contact with one delivers a paralytic jolt that leaves most creatures helpless. They aren't aggressive by nature, but their height makes them oblivious to smaller life below.
D_BestiaryData.GhostCrocodile-Lore1: Trapjaws are semi-subterranean reptilian predators endemic to the deep desert, notorious among prospectors as "Ghost Crocs." Their physiology allows them to dive beneath loose sand and "swim" through it at alarming speeds, using powerful lateral undulations and hardened dorsal plates to stay submerged. Despite their size and aggression, Trapjaws have surprisingly poor surface awareness-low perception that often results in sudden, chaotic ambushes triggered more by vibration than sight. They'll scavenge readily, but once agitated they behave like full predators, erupting from the sand in explosive lunges.
D_BestiaryData.Bear-Lore1: Unlike Bears on earth, Icarus Ursus horribilis have no need to hibernate. They also produce offspring at a much higher rate.
D_BestiaryData.Sandwyrm_Queen-Lore2: Unlike many modern threats on Icarus, Sandwyrm Queens are not exotic mutations but remnants of the planet's original biosphere-one of the few apex species resilient enough to survive failed terraforming and the collapse of native ecosystems. Their ability to fly, reproduce rapidly, and endure extreme arid climates gave them a significant evolutionary edge. Queens rarely appear on the surface unless provoked or during reproductive cycles, but when they do, their presence can destabilize entire regions.
D_BestiaryData.Scorpion_Boss-Lore2: Unlike most scorpions, this giant arachnid is territorial. It prefers a large plateau to nest, it's theorised that it may flatten it's surroundings to create an ideal hunting ground.
D_BestiaryData.Irradiated_Mutation-Lore2: Unlike ordinary Spectres, Wraiths are the product of extreme exotic contamination amplified by radiation exposure. The unstable fusion of exotic material and decaying human tissue accelerates mutation, reshaping the host into a crystalline predator. Without radiation, the exotics remain inert - but together, they twist biology into something wholly alien.
D_BestiaryData.Polar_Bear-Lore2: Valued by prospectors for their meat but especially for their fur which can be used to craft armor to protect against the harsh climates of Icarus. Generally avoided by novice prospectors.
D_BestiaryData.Arctic_Bat-Lore2: While nesting these bats can exhibit rather aggressive behaviour, to the extent that the Lagos Group has advised that contractors should leave any nests they find undisturbed. If left untreated, wounds from these creatures can cause severe distress, even death.
D_BestiaryData.Cave_Bat-Lore2: While nesting these bats can exhibit rather aggressive behaviour, to the extent that the Lagos Group has advised that contractors should leave any nests they find undisturbed. If left untreated, wounds from these creatures can cause severe distress, even death.
D_BestiaryData.Baby_Deer-Lore2: Widely considered by prospectors to be one of the most convenient sources of food on Icarus. Killing Baby Deer contributes to the Heartless Accolade.
D_BestiaryData.Wild_Boar-Lore1: Wild boar are medium-sized mammals with a stocky build, short legs, and bristly hair. They are typically brown or black in color and have curved tusks that protrude from their mouths.
D_BestiaryData.Wild_Boar-Lore2: Wild boar are strong and aggressive animals that can defend themselves against predators such as wolves and bears. They are also excellent runners and swimmers. However, they can be a nuisance to prospectors.
D_BestiaryData.Swamp_Quadruped-Lore1: With their long legs and height these creatures move surprisingly swiftly when in marshy areas. They are generally passive unless provoked.
D_BestiaryData.Forest_Wolf-Lore2: Wolves are skilled pack hunters that are capable of taking down prey many times their size. The subspecies introduced to Icarus are far more aggressive than those on Earth, and become easily fixated on humans who wander into their territory.
D_BestiaryData.Snow_Wolf-Lore2: Wolves are skilled pack hunters that are capable of taking down prey many times their size. The subspecies introduced to Icarus are far more aggressive than those on Earth, and become easily fixated on humans who wander into their territory.
D_BestiaryData.Irradiated_Mutation-Lore1: Wraiths are towering, heavily mutated remnants of human origin, their limbs stretched beyond natural limits and bodies studded with crystalline growths. Found deep within irradiated zones, they move with terrifying speed and precision, attacking anything that enters their territory. Contractors report that radiation levels spike sharply when one is near.
D_BestiaryData.Zebra-Lore1: Zebras are social animals that live in herds. They are herbivores and use their stripes as a form of camouflage to confuse predators.

D_CharacterFlags.Deposit_Meta_Resources_Visible-Descripti: Access to Workshop Radar and Extractor
D_CharacterFlags.Talent_GunpowderRecipe-Description: Character flag for the fertilizer to gunpowder recipe
D_CharacterFlags.Talent_ShotgunRecipe-Description: Character flag to make the Farmers Shotgun
D_CharacterFlags.Voxel_Meta_Resources_Visible-Description: Pickaxe Mineable Exotics to Appear on All Missions
D_CharacterFlags.Mission_BlackWolf_Items-Description: Unlocks Black Wolf Arrow & Knife (Character Only)
D_CharacterFlags.Mission_Sandworm_Items-Description: Unlocks Sandworm Weapons, Tools & Armor (Character Only)

D_CharacterFlags.StyxBlocker_D_TooltipOnly-Description: Unlocks Shortcut between Frozen Traverse and Ring Lake
D_CharacterFlags.StyxBlocker_E_TooltipOnly-Description: Unlocks Shortcut between The Great River and Dry Ridge
D_CharacterFlags.StyxBlocker_B_TooltipOnly-Description: Unlocks Shortcut between The Wall and Dry Ridge
D_CharacterFlags.NPC_Farmer_TooltipOnly-Description: Unlocks the Cultivation Specialist in this Open World region, allowing Crops to be traded for Ren.
D_CharacterFlags.NPC_Fisher_TooltipOnly-Description: Unlocks the Fisheries Officer in this Open World region, allowing Fish to be traded for Ren.
D_CharacterFlags.NPC_Norex_TooltipOnly-Description: Unlocks the Norex Liason in this Open World region, allowing Biomass to be traded for Creature Parts.
D_CharacterFlags.NPC_Hunter_TooltipOnly-Description: Unlocks the Predator Control Specialist in this Open World region, allowing Vestiges to be traded for Ren.

D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY3_Lab_8-Text:
"...not enough shielding, not enough time. We said it wasn't ready."
"We're dying, and they're still pushing for results."
static
"They called it a 'cost of progress'."
D_CollectableNotes.Icesheet_Cave_Note_2-Text: "Hans has completely lost it. He's threatening to cave in the entrance to the tunnels. We've been told to evac... Until we figure out what to do with him. Unfortunately, we have been using the cave as storage... All our food is there... I'm not sure what's worse, being stuck outside to starve or being trapped in there with whatever's taken over his brain. I'm scared."
D_CollectableNotes.TPS_Flavour_Note_7-Text:
"UDA stole our homes.
TPS stole our peace.
No heroes here.
Just people too angry to sleep."
D_CollectableNotes.GH_Ape_C_Procedure_C-Text:
- Always clean up after yourself
- Store all equipment in the upper storage area next to the battery
- Repair the Turbines on the roof, there is a hammer in the nearby cupboard
- Always wash your hands when entering and leaving the lab
- Disposed of failed samples, burn them if you need to
- Watch out for Group 15 and Norex they will try and impersonate lab members 
- Have Fun (Safely)

(Handwritten) Watch for the Garganutan - they have setup Lairs nearby
D_CollectableNotes.GH_Ape_C_Procedure_A-Text:
1. Gather A Sample - you need something to extract DNA from
2. Homogenize the Sample - this breaks open the cells to release the cell contents. 
3. Add Tris-EDTA - this helps to protect the DNA
4. Stir the Sample - This helps to dissolve the elements for uniform distribution
5. Heat the Sample - this helps with dissolution
6. Seperate the Solids and Liquids - This is easier for the next steps
7. Add Ethanol - this clumps the DNA together
8. Seperate the Solid from Liquids - this is so it can be easily examined
9. Examine with the Microscope to Confirm
D_CollectableNotes.GH_Ape_OutpostNote_1-Text: 1.1.24 - Captured subjects transported to new facility. I don't know why anyone would want to work in a desert.
D_CollectableNotes.GH_Ape_LaboratoryNote_1-Text: 1.2.5 - Subjects appear to be tolerating the new apparatus, hopeful for expansion to other clinics in the next quarter.
D_CollectableNotes.GH_Ape_LaboratoryNote_2-Text: 1.3.4 - Subjects have broken the current apparatus. Requesting reinforced equipment - estimated to arrive in approx 14 days.
D_CollectableNotes.GH_Ape_OutpostNote_2-Text: 1.3.8 - Desert facility reported problems with their experiment. Too bad they wouldn't listen to me.
D_CollectableNotes.GH_Ape_OutpostNote_3-Text: 1.5.12 - Received new enclosure materials today. Glad I can finally continue my research.
D_CollectableNotes.GH_Ape_OutpostNote_4-Text: 1.5.16 - New test subject responding positively to local food, requires high quantities to satisfy.
D_CollectableNotes.GH_Ape_LaboratoryNote_3-Text: 1.5.6 - Subjects have been observed dismantling the equipment for use as tools. Requesting reinforcement to the enclosure - estimated to arrive in approx 21 days.
D_CollectableNotes.GH_Ape_OutpostNote_5-Text: 1.6.2 - I've been ordered to assist the desert facility. I've fed Fluffy, he'll be okay for a few days. I'll be back soon.
D_CollectableNotes.GH_Ape_LaboratoryNote_4-Text: 1.6.4 - Reinforcement still not delivered. Subjects have created a crack in the main panel. Evacuating junior staff as a precaution.
D_CollectableNotes.GH_Ape_LaboratoryNote_5-Text: 1.6.5 - Subject loose in the lab. Many casualties. Requesting personnel reinforcement immediately... It's... It's trying to release the others.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY3_Lab_9-Text:
Access to Vault Theta is now by request only.
Following the incident, no interns are permitted below Floor -3.
Hazmat suits are mandatory until radiation decays below threshold.
Do not disturb the pods.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY1_Theo_1-Text:
Anti-Hangover Elixir:
Uranium + water + flour + sugar
You won't be hungover anymore, but you will be dead.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY2_Hut_1-Text: As per incident protocol I've evacuated all personnel with no traceable radiation contact, and discharged those who were deemed too high-risk to return to orbit.
D_CollectableNotes.GH_IM_O1_Notice-Text:
Attention
Researchers of Lab (LAB-12)

If you find yourself in trouble and can't make it back to the LAB-12, head to STR-X34.
It is located in a cave nearby and contains supplies, field equipment and backup data.
Use an ECHO Device.

- Senior Researcher Avery
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY3_Lab_2-Text:
BLACKLIST: 
Mo Chou - Terraforming Cohort Alpha
Sol Berlinski - First Cohort
Unknown faction member (suspected ACS involvement)
Iris Blake - Terraforming Cohort Alpha
Unknown Faction Member - (suspected TPS involvement)
Theodore Carter - ACS Barracks.  
Avoid contact with anyone listed in this document - suspects are considered a threat to the Group.
D_CollectableNotes.Ashlands_Bunker_Note_2-Text: Brenda, this may never reach you back home but if it does please know that I love you. I fear for my life in this place. You were right, I never should have left Earth. Give my love to the children. Yours, Gerald.
D_CollectableNotes.GH_RG_MiningCamp_1-Text: Buddy got too close to the drill today, we held a little ceremony and built him a little grave. He was the best cryogenically defrosted dog a man could hope for.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY3_Lab_5-Text:
Containment breach in Cold Lab 3.
Unknown compound reacted with atmospheric nitrogen.
Technician Flores exposed-no vitals on retrieval.
Disciplinary hearing postponed pending autopsy results.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY1_Iris_2-Text:
Day 12
We still haven't been able to locate many Group members yet, but Victor has reported finding a strange powder-like substance on the suits of fallen TPS members. 
I asked him to get me a sample but apparently, that big lump Theo decided to give the body a kick when they found it and it all flew off. A floundering bear of a man! Goodness, he's so annoying.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY1_Theo_2-Text: Does Group 15 mean there are 14 other groups we also have to find...?
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY3_Lab_7-Text:
Don't drink the water.
It glows at night now.
If you find Keller's boots, don't touch them.
-C.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY1_Mo_1-Text:
Dossier on TEI members
Dr Iris Blake - Checked in. Critical to success.
Victor Flynn - Checked in. Will provide valuable intel regarding TPS and their methods.
Theo Carter - Checked in. UDA mandatory hire from ACS. Word things cautiously around him.
Old friend - Not checked in. Identity withheld for security reasons. Note: Remember to apologize for that Lava Hunter incident.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY3_Lab_4-Text:
Effective immediately, five staff from the Oversight Board have been dismissed.
The leak was traced to internal recordings sent offworld by a known dissident.
Damage control is underway-media access denied.
DO NOT speak to press.
D_CollectableNotes.GH_IM_B_Note-Text:
Experimental 1:
Splicing Enzymes into Viscids
- Raw Aggression
- Rapid Deterioration
- Not Viable Test Subject

Experiment 2: 
Splicing Enzyme into Columbian Mammoth
- Increased Aggression
- Slow Deterioration
- Enzyme Decreased Core Temperature
- Not Viable Test Subject

(Scribbled at Bottom)
Woolly variety could possibly provide stable environment.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY3_Lab_3-Text:
Field readings near Site D exceeded 250 units/hr.
Recommend immediate evacuation of unshielded personnel.
Requesting replacement Geiger counters-two melted.
-Dr. Veska
D_CollectableNotes.TPS_Flavour_Note_3-Text:
Handwritten Letter (Never Sent):
I miss your laugh. I miss quiet.
Here it's all drills, static, and shouting.
They say we fight for the future, but it feels like we're killing the past.
I hope you don't see what I've become.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY3_Lab_6-Text:
Heller continues to object during trials despite prior warnings.
Fails to meet psychological resilience thresholds.
Recommend reassignment to sanitation or termination.
Not suitable for high-pressure ethical zones.
D_CollectableNotes.Icesheet_Outpost_Note_3-Text: I found your nasty note about me, WILLIAM. Let's see how well you survive with a nice big hole in your suit, OR YOUR HEAD.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY5_Note_5-Text:
I must do what needs to be done. Humanity is owed it. The UDA must pay.
There's no way around this, I'll be branded as a lunatic for even trying it.
No one will understand, not even Iris. I'm sorry, but I have to make this right.
No matter who gets in my way, I WILL terraform Icarus and SAVE MY PEOPLE.
And I don't care who has to die to make it happen.
D_CollectableNotes.GH_Ape_O1_Note-Text:
I refuse to leave my research in the hands of NOREX.

Screw the company, screw this job and screw the UDA while we're at it.

As soon as I've demolished this last section of dens, I am OUTTA HERE.

Man, I can't wait to eat a real steak again.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY5_Note_2-Text:
I should have known they'd betray us, all they care about is money!
Billions of us, stuck back on Earth, hoping for a better life. And they squandered it to balance their books?!
I never fully trusted the UDA, and after seeing what the Group is capable of...
I was a fool to return to Icarus.
But THEY were fools to bring me back.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY5_Note_4-Text:
I thought I was past this pain, it would appear that I can trust no one.
The lies, the manipulations of those right at the top. It's insanity.
How do I know my team aren't in on it? I can't tell them, they'll try to stop me.
They'll brush it off as a trauma response, they'll call me crazy.
Maybe I am. I don't care about anything but revenge right now.
D_CollectableNotes.Icesheet_Outpost_Note_1-Text: I've never seen anything like it, huge, with big angry horns and hooves the size of a car. Norex'll be all over this later.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY2_Hut_2-Text:
INCIDENT REPORT G15-0054:
ALL GROUP PERSONNEL ARE TO EVACUATE THE SECTOR IMMEDIATELY.
DISPOSE OF ALL RESEARCH BEFORE LEAVING BY ANY MEANS NECESSARY.
FAILURE TO DESTROY EVIDENCE OF GROUP OCCUPATION WILL RESULT IN TERMINATION.
- SPECIAL AGENT CLARKE
D_CollectableNotes.Post_Story_Note_2-Text:
Incident Report to Command

Classification: Confidential - For Command Review Only

Subject: After-Action Report - Fatality of Commander Mo Chou

On [date redacted], during an assault against TPS, Commander Mo Chou sustained fatal injuries as a result of hostile engagement in Sector Elysium. Despite immediate application of field medical protocols, she was unfortunately declared deceased on site.

Commander Chou conducted herself with exemplary composure and fulfilled her operational duties in full. Her actions directly contributed to the survival and extraction of her unit. She met her end honorably, in accordance with the highest traditions of service.

Command has been informed. Further details pertaining to enemy disposition and situational context have been logged separately under File Ref. [redacted].

Submitted respectfully,
Victor Flynn
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY1_Victor_2-Text: Intercepted a memo from TPS HQ - they're moving most operations to remote drone operators down here. Something has them spooked, but they're still a pain in my ass. They always seem to be one step ahead, I'll have the location of a base figured out and then... nothing but drones. It's like they're ghosts.
D_CollectableNotes.Icesheet_Cave_Note_1-Text: Jason D: Preliminary exploration has shown the presence of some sort of crystalline structure towards the rear of the cave. I've urged the team to keep their distance as it seems to emit some kind of vibration, like a resonating frequency. Note: Hans appears to be deteriorating more each time he enters. Could be prudent to have him exit the sector and catch an evac pod out for evaluation.
D_CollectableNotes.Post_Story_Note_3-Text:
Journal belonging to Iris Blake:

Another day without her, the first time I thought she was dead was hard enough.
But finding out she was alive after all that time only to lose her again a few weeks later? 
I don't know if I'll ever recover from this heartbreak. I miss you Mo. And I'm so so sorry for what we did to you.
- The remainder of this entry is smudged with tears -
D_CollectableNotes.Post_Story_Note_1-Text:
Letter adressed to Mr Berlinski:

Dear Sol,

I write with a weight I can hardly bear. Mo is gone. She fell in the line of duty, and though they'll dress it in the language of reports and commendations, I can't bring myself to speak of her in such cold terms with you.

She fought until her last breath, not for orders or objectives, but for us - for the people beside her and the future she still believed in. There was no fear in her, only that quiet strength you know so well. Even in her final moments, she carried herself with a steadiness that reminded us all who we were following.

You were her anchor beyond the battlefield, her reminder of home and of who she was outside the uniform. She spoke of you often, sometimes in small ways, sometimes with a softness that Icarus could never strip from her. I thought you should know that when the end came, she was not alone - she was surrounded by those who cared, and her name was carried with reverence.

I'm so sorry, Sol. For the world's loss, and for yours.

With respect and grief,
Dr Iris Blake
D_CollectableNotes.GH_RG_MiningOutpost_1-Text: Message from Site Alpha - WARNING - The Caveworms seem irritated, like something is occupying their tunnels - Report any strange behaviour to the UDA immediately.
D_CollectableNotes.Icesheet_Cave_Note_3-Text: Oh god, what have I become? The lights, they turned on me. They aren't beautiful at all, they burn and hurt and bleed. The cave is dark but it's also so BRIGHT. It hurts but I can't help myself, I have to get closer. I need it. The others don't understand, they hate me.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY1_Iris_1-Text:
POSTCARD FROM EARTH
Hi darling, we miss you so much already, come back for a holiday soon when you've finished that investigation of yours! 
Your father and I are so proud of you for going back out there after all that fuss with the terraforming last time.
Remember to stay hydrated, you never know what nasty bugs are out there.
Love you, Mumsie xx
D_CollectableNotes.TPS_Flavour_Note_4-Text:
Personal Log - Dario H.
UDA doesn't see us as people. Just stats.
Still, burning that ACS prospector alive didn't sit right.
The radicals call it justice-I call it revenge.
Maybe we're becoming what we hated.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY1_Mo_3-Text:
Question everything, do not trust the UDA
Join TPS and FIGHT for your RIGHTS
We will burn the UDA from the inside - JOIN US TODAY
D_CollectableNotes.TPS_Flavour_Note_1-Text:
Ration drop's late again.
Tinned beans and vitamin paste, that's it?
TPS Command says "adapt."
Bet they're not eating this shit in orbit.
D_CollectableNotes.GH_IM_O1_StorageNote-Text:
Research Directive:
Enzyme Experimentation & Enhancement
Study the effects of surplus terraforming enzymes on the introduced and evolved species in the Prometheus region. Investigate uses for human enhancement and potential weapon applications for THE COMPANY.
D_CollectableNotes.GH_Ape_C_Procedure_B-Text: Scalpels are sharp, and they can be found in the Surgical Equipment. Please be careful the UDA does not cover injuries to self while on planet.
D_CollectableNotes.Ashlands_Bunker_Note_3-Text: Screw the UDA, they don't pay me enough to deal with this crap. Note to self: negotiate higher fees for the next drop.
D_CollectableNotes.GH_IM_ResearcherNote_1-Text: Something about the enzymes has been causing the surrounding ice and arctic matter to cling to the creatures.Terry wouldn't tell us where he got the vats from, he's always worked like that.I guess learning from Dr Lee would do that to anyone... He told me I'd get fast tracked to IntSec if I joined his team. I should have known better, now I'm going to die out here.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY3_Experiments-Text:
Subspecies 1341 testing complete - no viable subjects remain. 
Operations halted until further funding is secured.
D_CollectableNotes.TPS_Flavour_Note_6-Text:
TPS Internal Message Log:
Command says we'll push south next week.
Not all of us are ready-we lost three to a whiteout yesterday.
They ignore it. "Glory to the cause," right?
I didn't sign up to die of bad logistics.
D_CollectableNotes.TPS_Flavour_Note_5-Text:
TPS cooks are either sadists or out of salt.
If I eat one more protein brick, I'll riot.
Note: avoid the green ones.
Even the dreadwings wouldn't touch them.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY3_Lab_1-Text:
TRANSFER PAPERS FOR MR C L RIORNON
Subject shows great promise in human trials, dishonorably discharged for aiding a fugitive.
No rights remain.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY1_Mo_2-Text: Thanks for the hire, M. Not many know my background, but I trust you not to share it with the group. We wouldn't want anyone going overboard. -V
D_CollectableNotes.Ashlands_Bunker_Note_1-Text: The comms are shot, nothing in or out. The new guy who arrived yesterday is completely unstable. I caught him draining his canteen outside this morning. He said he doesn't need water out here. He's crazy, I'm leaving this note in case something happens to us, I don't trust him.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY2_Delta-Text: The data in this file is encrypted - please refer to your direct report within the Group for access.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY2_Epsilon-Text: The data in this file is encrypted - please refer to your direct report within the Group for access.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY2_Laptop-Text: The data in this file is encrypted - please refer to your direct report within the Group for access.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY5_Note_1-Text:
The data must be wrong, there's no way the UDA would do this to us.
I can't sleep, I keep running the numbers, reading the files...
All this time, after years of research... wasted. How many have died back on Earth due to this cover up?
Our one chance at colonizing a new planet, properly...
People back home are dying of hunger, while the UDA line their pockets.
D_CollectableNotes.GH_IM_O1-Text: The enzyme-induced mutation weakens the creatures' ability to withstand environmental stresses, particularly high heat. Controlled exposure to flame significantly disrupts their biology, suggesting fire as a potential method for neutralization.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY5_Note_3-Text:
There must be a way to fix this, this can't be a coincidence.
I've found this data for a reason. I owe it to humanity to save them.
I still can't sleep, I can't get this idea out of my head.
What if there was a way to restart it? Those enzymes back at the lab...
It must be fate, they've been left there for me to use.
D_CollectableNotes.TPS_Flavour_Note_8-Text:
They keep calling this a revolution.
Feels more like a slow collapse.
Hasko said we'll be legends.
I just want to go home.
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY3_Terraforming-Text:
Top Secret - Eyes Only (Level: Black)
Planetary Designation: WOLF-1061ca
Report ID: UDA-STRAT/2025-0918
Prepared by: Directorate of Resource Valuation & Contingency Affairs
Date: REDACTED

Executive Summary

Preliminary environmental and geochemical modelling indicates that the ongoing terraforming initiative on WOLF-1061ca carries a 98% probability of technical success within projected implementation windows. While this outcome fulfills the stated colonization mandate, it will irreversibly eliminate the currently observed deposits of so-called "exotic material"-a class of substrates exhibiting physical properties and market valuation far exceeding conventional resource classes.

Independent valuation models and market simulations estimate the in-situ value of these exotics at multiple quadrillions of USD (nominal) at current commodity and derivative pricing assumptions. The removal of these deposits through successful ecological engineering therefore represents a multi-trillion (and, more precisely, multi-quadrillion) dollar opportunity cost to the United Development Agency (UDA) and its private partners.

Given the magnitude of the latent value, the Directorate recommends that the UDA consider deliberately preserving access to exotic deposits through managed narrative control and the presentation of a credible-albeit falsified-terraforming failure. This preserves the resource base while maintaining plausible deniability and commercial exclusivity for the UDA consortium.

Key Findings

Terraforming Success Probability: Current technical assessment yields P(success) = 0.98 based on thermal, hydrological, and atmospheric intervention models. Confidence interval: 0.7% (model variance).

Exotic Material Status: Geochemical surveys, remote spectrometry, and limited-core sampling confirm concentrated deposits across several basins. Laboratory assays reveal energy-coupled crystalline lattices and anomalous isotopic ratios consistent with high-value industrial and speculative applications.

Estimated Economic Value: Conservative market models place the material's extractable value in the quadrillions of dollars (nominal). This figure accounts for scarcity premiums, strategic premiums for non-replicable materials, and derivative market multiplier effects.

Strategic Uniqueness: WOLF-1061ca is the only planetary candidate within the system meeting simultaneous habitability and deposit accessibility criteria. Alternative colony candidates will require additional transit and terraforming investment, but such alternatives exist and are considered tractable if allowed.

Strategic Recommendation (Summary)

Public/Official Track: Continue visible terraforming operations to satisfy political stakeholders and maintain operational cover.

Commercial/Covert Track: Prepare a controlled information campaign and contingency narrative that can be deployed to credibly portray the terraforming effort as failed or irreparably compromised, should it become strategically advantageous to preserve the deposits.

Resource Preservation: Retain sampling, staking, and covert claim mechanisms to ensure UDA commercial control of exotic deposits should a public withdrawal be enacted.

Alternative Colonization: Initiate immediate scouting and low-cost preparatory work on secondary candidates within the sector to ensure human expansion proceeds without forfeiting the exotic yield.

Note: Recommendation 2 (narrative management) is proposed as a strategic, non-kinetic toolset. Operational specifics for execution must remain compartmentalized and handled by the Directorate of Information and Plausible Contingency (DIPC). No tactical sabotage or unlawful endangerment of personnel is advised or implied.

Risk Assessment

Reputational Risk: Any revelation of deliberate misrepresentation would incur severe political and legal consequences, domestically and across allied systems.

Operational Risk: Maintaining a deception requires sustained effort and introduces long-term intelligence burdens.

Moral/Political Risk: Preserving exotics at the cost of colonization for existing human migratory needs may fuel intra-governmental dissent.

Mitigant: Rapid development of alternative colony options and a rigorous, compartmentalized communications plan will reduce exposure.

Financial Overview

Value at Stake (Extractable): Multiple quadrillions USD (nominal).

Estimated Present Value to UDA (if preserved & monetized under exclusive control): Substantially greater than combined near-term gains from colonization allowances and standard resource extraction. Precise monetization projections available on request under separate fiscal modelling addendum (Black-vaulted).

Ethical & Legal Notice

The contents of this document are extremely sensitive. Disclosure beyond pre-authorized senior UDA channels is prohibited. This recommendation contemplates strategic communications posture rather than operational harm; however, any course of action involving intentional public misstatement shall be reviewed by the Office of Legal Counsel to assess statutory exposure and political consequences.

Conclusion

The terraforming project on WOLF-1061ca is, by all measurable criteria, poised to succeed. Success, however, will annihilate an asset of unparalleled value. The UDA faces a starkly binary choice: proceed with colonization and forfeit quadrillions in exotic returns, or preserve the deposits by means of a controlled narrative and pursue colonization elsewhere. For reasons of long-term strategic wealth and sovereign advantage, the Directorate advises that the latter path be prepared and reserved - executed with the utmost secrecy and by the narrowest possible circle of trust.

Classification: BLACK - STRICTLY CONFIDENTIAL.
Distribution: Prime Director, Chief Economic Strategist, Head of DIPC, Legal Counsel (on a strictly need-to-know basis).

Prepared with full awareness of the gravity of recommendation. The calculus is clear: some fortunes are too vast to surrender in the name of sentiment.
D_CollectableNotes.TPS_Flavour_Note_2-Text:
Torn Page from a Journal:
Sometimes I dream of coffee and traffic lights.
Woke up today thinking I was back on Earth.
Then Hasko screamed about another patrol and I remembered.
We chose this-but hell, did we?
D_CollectableNotes.Mission_ELY3_Laser-Text:
UDA - Group 15
Orbital Laser Activation Log
Classification: RESTRICTED - Need-to-Know

Log entries (no dates). Each entry corresponds to a discrete activation event.

LOG-001 - Operation: Borealis Sweep
Activation ID: G15-AL/001
Duration: 00:00:45 (firing window)
Target Vector: Sector 7B - Unmanned infrastructure cluster
Authorization: Code GREY-SHIELD (Commanded)
Result: Target neutralized; collateral within projected bounds.
Remarks: Routine engagement under direct operational orders.

LOG-002 - Operation: Silent Harbor
Activation ID: G15-AL/002
Duration: 00:01:12
Target Vector: Approach corridor - hostile reconnaissance package
Authorization: Code IRON-VEIL (Field)
Result: Hostile asset disabled.
Remarks: Post-shot telemetry nominal.

LOG-003 - Operation: Iron Canticle
Activation ID: G15-AL/003
Duration: 00:00:30
Target Vector: Surface-automated mining node
Authorization: Code BLACK-KEEP (Commanded)
Result: Node incinerated to prevent capture.
Remarks: Scorched perimeter confirmed.

LOG-004 - Operation: Dusk Curtain
Activation ID: G15-AL/004
Duration: 00:02:05
Target Vector: Orbital debris field (precision carve)
Authorization: Code SILVER-LATCH (Field)
Result: Debris dispersal successful; two secondary fragments catalogued.
Remarks: Debris catalog forwarded to Logistics.

LOG-005 - Operation: Echo Bastion
Activation ID: G15-AL/005
Duration: 00:00:55
Target Vector: Ground-based artillery emplacements (hostile)
Authorization: Code RED-ANCHOR (Commanded)
Result: Emplacements neutralized.
Remarks: Brief comms blackout observed during engagement.

LOG-006 - Operation: Hollow Mercy
Activation ID: G15-AL/006
Duration: 00:01:40
Target Vector: Supply convoy (armored)
Authorization: Code LONE-PIER (Field)
Result: Convoy disabled; salvage teams dispatched.
Remarks: Salvage yielded classified components; inventory pending.

LOG-007 - Operation: Glass Harbor
Activation ID: G15-AL/007
Duration: 00:00:20
Target Vector: Coastal radio array (denial strike)
Authorization: Code OATH-BIND (Commanded)
Result: Array destroyed.
Remarks: Communications on local band suppressed for 18 cycles.

LOG-008 - Operation: Nightfall Accord
Activation ID: G15-AL/008
Duration: 00:01:05
Target Vector: Mobile siege platform
Authorization: Code STEEL-VERGE (Field)
Result: Platform disabled.
Remarks: One operative reported minor exposure to pulse echo.

LOG-009 - Operation: Quiet Ledger
Activation ID: G15-AL/009
Duration: 00:00:35
Target Vector: Extraction staging area (denial)
Authorization: Code CIPHER-FOIL (Commanded)
Result: Staging infrastructure neutralized.
Remarks: Evidence of unauthorized access to UDA manifests discovered.

LOG-010 - Operation: Meridian Scour
Activation ID: G15-AL/010
Duration: 00:02:30
Target Vector: High-yield processing facility (hostile)
Authorization: Code FALCON-CLAUSE (Commanded)
Result: Facility rendered inoperable.
Remarks: Significant thermal signature; remediation teams required.

LOG-011 - Operation: Last Ledger
Activation ID: G15-AL/011
Duration: 00:00:50
Target Vector: Secured cache compound (covert deny)
Authorization: Code NIGHT-TRUSS (Compartmented)
Result: Cache neutralized; inventory destroyed as per directive.
Remarks: Personnel transfer logged post-engagement. Internal audit flagged.

LOG-012 - Operation: Shadow Allowance (Compartmented)
Activation ID: G15-AL/012
Duration: 00:00:10
Target Vector: Personnel transit node - precision interdiction
Authorization: Code VELLUM-NULL (Black-circuited)
Result: Transit node temporarily incapacitated; target extraction prevented.
Remarks: After-action: evidence of misappropriated classified goods. Subject identified: Mo Chou - thief. Internal referral to DIPC and Legal for containment and recovery actions.

End of log.
Prepared by: Operational Records - Group 15
Distribution: Group 15 Command; Directorate Audit Cell (on request)
Integrity Hash: UDA-G15-LOG-INT/7F3A (do not alter)
D_CollectableNotes.GH_RG_MiningCamp_2-Text: We weren't paid... AGAIN! UDA thinks they can just expect us to keep working just because they have the only way off this rock. I'm going to contact Sol, my crew needs to be paid.
D_CollectableNotes.Icesheet_Outpost_Note_2-Text: We're down to three of us out here. Mike and Joe turned tail and left us but they won't last five minutes out there by themselves. It's only me and Jason now, I'm pretty sure Hans is a lost cause. He has lost his mind, keeps talking about lights. Refuses to eat or drink anything. He's a goner.

D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_D_4-Text-6: I'll do my best to prevent theft of any company property, but I can't guarantee it.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_ADD_D1-Text-1: I've heard that this method also works on humans.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionOne_Lore2-Text-8: "Do you really trust anyone else to investigate"... Yeah. He was right. I don't.
D_Dialogue.ExterminationLandingSpare4-Text-1: 'Til someone can take out the creature in question, their people are refusing to set foot in the region.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_END_4-Text-11: ... Confirmed. What were we talking about again?
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionFour_7-Text-2: A PROCESS TO TERRAFORM THE ELYSIUM QUADRANT IS UNDERWAY
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionFour_7-Text-4: A PROCESS TO TERRAFORM THE ELYSIUM QUADRANT IS UNDERWAY
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_D_1-Text-8: A basic radio will have to suffice.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionFive_5-Text-2: A cascade reaction? Half the planet could be gone in seconds.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionFour_2-Text-4: A colony for the hopeless, she called it.
D_Dialogue.PromDispatchEvent3-Text-2: A few of our previous contractors encountered... obstacles.
D_Dialogue.GH_RG_A_INTRO-Text-4: A few of them have... gone fishing?... wait. no. Missing. Gone Missing. Uh... that was a few days ago.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_C_2-Text-1: A few years back there was an... incident. The IT team were never the same afterwards.
D_Dialogue.BrandRemarkShengong2-Text-0: A fine example of Shengong tech.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_OPT1_2-Text-3: A great reminder that your accident insurance isn't covered by the UDA. Or Norex.
D_Dialogue.RelocatedBriefing-Text-1: A group of Zebras have broken outta their research facility.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_B_4-Text-11: A helpless mining outpost surrounded by deadly creatures, what could go wrong?
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_C2_1-Text-5: A mammoth undertaking, if you will. Haha.
D_Dialogue.PromFractureEvent6-Text-9: A moment prospector. I need to... request an operation.
D_Dialogue.GH_AGENT_NEW_APE_E2_04-Text-2: A predator eating the flesh of an experimental creature can't be a good thing.
D_Dialogue.DH_Bark_Theo_13-Text-0: A quiet day's a good day. Don't expect it to last.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_D2_6-Text-1: A swarm of... something... is headed your way.
D_Dialogue.ACSBriefingDonut2-Text-0: ACS just put a contract up.
D_Dialogue.ACSBriefingDonut3-Text-0: ACS might have all the tech in the world, but they need someone who knows Icarus.
D_Dialogue.FM2RecoveryLanding-Text-3: ACS wants you to scout the wreckage, retrieve their tech, and bring it back.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_C_4-Text-5: AGENT will give you the coordinates on the station.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_D_4-Text-5: AGENT will give you the coordinates.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_B_6-Text-9: AGENT will have your next assignment ready for you shortly. Won't you AGENT?
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_B_4-Text-15: AGENT! Override - Sierra Alpha Fiver Fiver Beta Zero Tango. Mission complete.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_D2_7-Text-7: AGENT! WHAT HAVE I TOLD YOU ABOUT-
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_C2_8-Text-3: AGENT? What is it this time?
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionFour_7-Text-1: ALL PROSPECTORS MUST EVACUATE FROM THIS SECTOR IMMEDIATELY
D_Dialogue.RecoveryActivateItem4b_1-Text-0: Aaand now ... they want you to turn it on.
D_Dialogue.OpenWorldEvent1-Text-6: Abandoning all your planetside tech is a thing of the past if you prefer.
D_Dialogue.OpenWorldEvent2-Text-3: Abandoning all your planetside tech is a thing of the past if you prefer.
D_Dialogue.PromNomadEvent10-Text-2: Abandoning all your planetside tech is a thing of the past if you prefer.
D_Dialogue.V2PromNomadEvent11-Text-3: Abandoning all your planetside tech is a thing of the past if you prefer.
D_Dialogue.Expedition4aEnterRegion-Text-5: About the only thing Lagos is sure of is there's an avalanche in your way.
D_Dialogue.ResearchMineVoxel-Text-0: According to intel, folk have been finding strange formations inside ore from Icarus.
D_Dialogue.ExplorationBriefing5-Text-1: According to the UDA, you just graduated.
D_Dialogue.ExplorationBriefing4b-Text-0: According to the UDA, you just qualified for full access to this area.
D_Dialogue.ExplorationBriefing1-Text-0: According to the UDA, you qualify for open access to this region.
D_Dialogue.FM2RecoveryCraftItem2-Text-1: According to the specs, it should reduce local mass.
D_Dialogue.FM2RecoveryFindItem2-Text-6: According to the specs, there should be one more piece.
D_Dialogue.BW4_006_BOSSSPAWN1-Text-0: Activating the satellite must've alerted the wildlife.
D_Dialogue.GH_IM_NEW_C_01-Text-4: Actually we've been very busy. Immensely so.
D_Dialogue.StyxCExpeditionMissionComplete-Text-2: Actually, The work order just... vanished.
D_Dialogue.V2PromNomadEvent6-Text-4: Additionally the contractor wanted the following message passed to you:
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_E_4-Text-0: After all that, I wonder if the readings from this thing will even be of any use.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_OPT2_4-Text-0: After all that, I wonder if the readings from this thing will even be of any use.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_B_3-Text-8: After an extensive search we have not been able to locate their whereabouts.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionOne_Lore2-Text-1: After the discovery in Prometheus, Sol had all the evidence stored as collateral on a secure server.
D_Dialogue.StyxDExpeditionFoundWall-Text-1: After what the ACS did around here, I'm surprised there are caves at all.
D_Dialogue.PromFractureIntro-Text-3: After your performance on our last assignment, we are confident you will rise to the challenge.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionOne_Lore2-Text-0: Ah I should probably tell you how I ended up here.
D_Dialogue.PromTempestIntro1-Text-4: Ah and..one.. one more thing... That audiolog you found last time, well it sounded a lot like one of my old crew.
D_Dialogue.DH_ELY_EDEN_AUDIOLOG_1-Text-3: Ah crap, I've got another call coming in, I have to take this.
D_Dialogue.DeviceInteractionBroken2-Text-0: Ah damn, looks like they've killed it.
D_Dialogue.PromTempestEvent10End-Text-0: Ah excellent, the Group thanks you for your efforts today. We will have more work for you soon.
D_Dialogue.TimerRanOutCharacterLost1-Text-0: Ah friend, I'd hoped I wouldn't lose you.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_ADD_D2-Text-0: Ah there it is, looks like they're broadcasting coordinates for any new drop sites.
D_Dialogue.GH_AGENT_NEW_APE_D_01-Text-0: Ah there it is, looks like they're broadcasting coordinates for any new drop sites. You'd better get moving.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_D_1_2-Text-0: Ah there it is, looks like they're broadcasting coordinates for any new drop sites. You'd better get moving.
D_Dialogue.StyxEExpeditionMissionComplete-Text-3: Ah unless you did repair it right.
D_Dialogue.FM2RecoveryCraftItem2-Text-5: Ah well ... back to the drawing board, I guess.
D_Dialogue.Expedition4aBossDead-Text-3: Ah well, it did the job.
D_Dialogue.RelocatedEndingB-Text-0: Ah well, there's always other opportunities.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_END_4-Text-4: Ah what a relief. I never have to think about this ever again.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_C2_8-Text-0: Ah yes, the preferred method of human communication - Projectile weaponry.
D_Dialogue.BrandRemarkLM1-Text-0: Ah, I see you've got some Larkwell Martinez on ya.
D_Dialogue.Ely_OpeningMission_3-Text-1: Ah, Mo? You need to warn them. They'll need to make preparations.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionOne_10-Text-0: Ah, hello prospector. Mo's told me a great deal about you. I look forward to working with you.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_B_3-Text-0: Ah, it would appear that the researchers have noted down the locations from which they observed these creatures.
D_Dialogue.DesertRemark2-Text-1: Ah, just my eyes playing tricks on me.
D_Dialogue.PromNomadEvent2-Text-0: Ah, looks like land wasn't the only thing adapted around here.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_OPT2_8-Text-0: Ah, so the creatures are weak to explosives. Shocking. What creature wouldn't be?
D_Dialogue.ArcticRemark1-Text-0: Ah, the Arctic. Or at least, that's what we call it in the Terrazone.
D_Dialogue.PromDispatchEvent3-Text-0: Ah, this is the location, Prospector. Now to get you inside...
D_Dialogue.PromTempestEvent8-Text-1: Ah, this may be asking too much. But please understand, it's important. For a... a friend.
D_Dialogue.GH_AGENT_NEW_APE_OPT1_03-Text-0: Ah, what a surprise. SMPL3 owes me ten dollars.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionFive_1-Text-0: Ah, yeah. Seems like she's taking things into her own hands.
D_Dialogue.BW5_010_BOSSSPAWN-Text-2: Aim for the head! or whatever that is!
D_Dialogue.BW5_011_BOSSSPAWNPG-Text-2: Aim for the head! or whatever that is!
D_Dialogue.Expedition4bBossSpawn-Text-2: Aim for the head! or whatever that is!
D_Dialogue.BW5_003_APPROACHCAVE-Text-2: Ain't got much choice, though, do ya?
D_Dialogue.SpecialGenericLanding2-Text-0: Ain't no-one said it's gonna be easy.
D_Dialogue.PromTempestIntro1-Text-12: All Group 15 data is also encrypted, for your safety, of course.
D_Dialogue.PromShadowedEvent10-Text-0: All done? Let's get that beacon down and transmitting then.
D_Dialogue.QuipFiller7-Text-0: All in a day's work. Good job.
D_Dialogue.PromNomadEvent2-Text-3: All of 'em weird... and probably dangerous.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_END_1-Text-1: All of our trials have indicated that this creature is extremely durable.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionFour_End-Text-1: All our evidence, all our hope of us actually holding G15 accountable. Mo is going to be... furious.
D_Dialogue.PromDispatchIntro-Text-4: All previous contractors have failed to apprehend this suspect. We expect better from you. Do not disappoint us.
D_Dialogue.SMPL3_GENERIC_3-Text-0: All required items are located in the nearby crate.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_C2_6-Text-8: All we can do now is wait.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_E_3-Text-13: All we can do now is wait.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_F_7-Text-7: All we can do now is wait.
D_Dialogue.FM2RecoveryCraftItem1-Text-5: All you gotta do is put it together.
D_Dialogue.RecoverySEDeviceReady1-Text-0: All you gotta do is turn it on, wait, and let the magic happen.
D_Dialogue.ExtractionRadarShowsExotics3-Text-2: All you gotta do now is extract 'em and get 'em to orbit.
D_Dialogue.Expedition2aDeviceDeployed-Text-0: All you gotta do now is turn it on when the storm's hot.
D_Dialogue.ReturnItemsToDropship2-Text-0: All you gotta do now, is get that stuff back to orbit.
D_Dialogue.StockPileLanding1-Text-0: All you gotta do now, is get that stuff back to orbit.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_D2_1-Text-3: All you need is the correct technology to track it. Like me. Please, hold your applause.
D_Dialogue.AshlandsIntro-Text-3: Allegedly, the place is a deathtrap; completely uninhabitable, very little natural resources, and it's unmappable.
D_Dialogue.StyxIntroLanding-Text-0: Allllllright, your survey equipment was loaded onto your dropship, make sure to grab it.
D_Dialogue.PromFractureEvent20-Text-0: Alright "Clarke", if that's even your real name. It seems we have ourselves a situation.
D_Dialogue.GH_AGENT_NEW_APE_C2_03-Text-0: Alright my master of mayhem, flip that switch and let's get started.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionSix_Intro-Text-0: Alright prospector, due to your efforts we've pinpointed the location TPS have been operating from.
D_Dialogue.GenericLandingExploring1-Text-0: Alright, it's finally time to explore. Stay sharp out there.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionSix_3-Text-0: Alright, prospector, we've made it to the lab. God what a mess they've left it in.
D_Dialogue.PromFractureEvent14-Text-0: Alright, that did it. Seems like it's stopped transmitting, but keep an eye out just in case. We aren't out of the woods yet.
D_Dialogue.PromOffenderEvent9End-Text-0: Alright, that seems like us done for now. Until next time friend.
D_Dialogue.PromOffenderEvent5-Text-0: Alright, uh, that looks like all of it. Time to blast it back up to Group 15.
D_Dialogue.ExterminationDenLocationRevealed2-Text-0: Alright, we're closing in on it.
D_Dialogue.PromNomadEvent6-Text-0: Alright, you got the stupid thing.
D_Dialogue.V2PromNomadEvent3-Text-0: Alright, you got the stupid thing.
D_Dialogue.StyxDExpeditionMissionComplete-Text-0: Alright. Getting a good signal. Lagos is giving the all clear.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionTwo_Intro-Text-0: Alrighty then, I've been tinkering with an old radio I found in one of the crates out here.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_E_2-Text-2: Although, I suppose the terraforming also did that, in a rather.. melty desolvey manner.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_A_3-Text-1: Although... no one said anything about not reading said documents...
D_Dialogue.SMPL3_GENERIC_20-Text-0: An O.E.S is en route to your location.
D_Dialogue.FM3ExterminationBriefing-Text-1: An animal is causing problems for their forward team.

D_Dialogue.GH_APE_B_6-Text-3: But you are an independent contractor.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_D_1-Text-2: But you don't care about that, do you?
D_Dialogue.FM1ResearchFindItem2-Text-3: But you got what you came for.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_OPT2_1-Text-3: But you wouldn't know anything about that, would you.
D_Dialogue.SurveyDeviceDeployedWater3-Text-1: But you'll need to keep an eye on it.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionSix_End-Text-3: But, she may never forgive me. And she doesn't have to. We were able to agree on one thing, however.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionSix_End-Text-8: But, she started the Eris Inquisition with a mission. The truth of Group 15 and the UDA's meddling is still out there.
D_Dialogue.GH_RG_A_TO_CAMP-Text-1: But... I doubt you'll find any of them alive.
D_Dialogue.PromNomadIntro-Text-2: Buuut it looks like the UDA are finally opening it up for the rest of us.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_OPT1_3-Text-1: By my estimates this group only survived a few days on their own.
D_Dialogue.V2PromNomadBriefing-Text-4: By the looks of it the UDA want you to test some... bloody insulting... New AI tech.
D_Dialogue.StyxBExpeditionBriefing-Text-4: Can thank the ACS mischief for that.
D_Dialogue.DH_Bark_Iris_17-Text-0: Can we please get more secure equipment? This old stuff's falling apart.
D_Dialogue.DevicePaused5-Text-1: Can you fire it back up?
D_Dialogue.ASHLANDS_RESCUE_CHURCH_INTRO-Text-3: Can you head out and bring them back? They're probably in rough shape.
D_Dialogue.GenericBriefingGroupFifteen1-Text-3: Can you keep your mouth shut?
D_Dialogue.DH_Bark_Theo_20-Text-0: Can't afford to make mistakes in this line of work.
D_Dialogue.PromOffenderIntro1-Text-6: Can't tell if that makes them crazy, brilliant.... or maybe just suicidal.
D_Dialogue.AshlandsBriefing-Text-3: Can't think of anyone else crazy enough to run headfirst into this kind of a place.
D_Dialogue.StyxIntroBriefing-Text-3: Can't think of anything else that would have them open this place back up.
D_Dialogue.Expedition4bFoundFragment4-Text-3: Cause Icarus will ruin your day.
D_Dialogue.RecoveryLandingGeneric2-Text-4: Cause it ain't gonna be there long.
D_Dialogue.GenericBriefing4-Text-4: Cause this one's gonna get wild.
D_Dialogue.ConstructionLandingMultiLocation2-Text-2: Cause until their people have places, they can't do much.
D_Dialogue.GenericLanding2-Text-1: Cause without this, their plans are screwed.
D_Dialogue.StyxBExpeditionLocatedCave-Text-1: Cave is marked on your map.
D_Dialogue.AshlandsIntro-Text-7: Challenge like this... seems right up your alley.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionFive_4-Text-2: Chances of successful terraforming... less than... Less than two percent.
D_Dialogue.Recon_Low_Food-Text-1: Changed their genes some, but you can still eat 'em.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionFour_11-Text-1: Check all the rooms prospector. With the Terraforming Lab as a priority.

D_Dialogue.NULSEC_NPC_CHURCH_THANK_01-Text-0: Cheers mate. You're a real one.
D_Dialogue.DH_Bark_Theo_14-Text-0: Chou keeps pushing us, but I'm not really sure where we're headed.
D_Dialogue.OpenWorldEvent1-Text-7: Chuck 'em in the pod, and it drops it all off at the station
D_Dialogue.OpenWorldEvent2-Text-4: Chuck 'em in the pod, and it drops it all off at the station. Pretty cool huh?
D_Dialogue.PromNomadEvent10-Text-3: Chuck 'em in the pod, and it drops it all off at the station. Pretty cool huh?
D_Dialogue.V2PromNomadEvent11-Text-4: Chuck 'em in the pod, and it drops it all off at the station. Pretty cool huh?
D_Dialogue.FactionRemarkSinotai1-Text-0: Classic Sinotai, always one step ahead.
D_Dialogue.PromFractureEvent17-Text-4: Classified my ass, keep going Prospector!
D_Dialogue.PROM_FRACTURE_EVENT17c-Text-2: Classified my ass, keep going Prospector.
D_Dialogue.DH_ELY_EDEN_AUDIOLOG_1-Text-1: Cmon, I bet you're loving the limelight.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionOne_7-Text-1: Come and find me first so I can deliver your briefing.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionOne_6-Text-1: Come and find me first, I'm upstairs.
D_Dialogue.ASHLANDS_CRISIS_CHURCH_OUTRO-Text-4: Come back and talk to me when you're ready.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionFive_End-Text-1: Come back to Eden when you're ready. And make sure you're prepared.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionOne_1-Text-5: Come here. You're supposed to be a senior here Theo, what the hell are you thinking?!
D_Dialogue.PromTempestSolBeg3-Text-0: Come on prospector. I'll... I'll owe you one.
D_Dialogue.StyxBExpeditionCollectEquipmentB-Text-0: Come on prospector. You'll need your radar. It's in your drop pod.
D_Dialogue.FTUE_Weather-Text-0: Comes a lot worse than showers on Icarus
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_END_4-Text-0: Congratulations, please set any broken bones and stem your bleeding while I validate your progress.
D_Dialogue.StyxIntroLanding-Text-1: Consider'n you're first on site they've tried to keep you away from the more risky areas. Allegedly.
D_Dialogue.FillerRemarkSuspicion4-Text-0: Considering it's been shut down for several years, this place doesn't look too bad.
D_Dialogue.GH_RG_A_TO_CAMP-Text-0: Contractor, I've labeled the ill-fated mining outpost on your map.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_A_1-Text-8: Contractor, I've marked the definitely-not-a-lab on your map.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_C2_1-Text-0: Contractor, The Company has used the data gathered from your previous efforts to pinpoint their latest location.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_C2_8-Text-8: Contractor, Well done. You might have a career in R&D yet.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_END_1-Text-0: Contractor, all the data you've pulled for us so far is pointing to something big. Really big.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_C2_6-Text-0: Contractor, another log file has been decrypted. Reading it for you now.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_D_4-Text-0: Contractor, another log file has been decrypted. Reading it for you now.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_D_5-Text-0: Contractor, nice work on the demolition.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_B_1-Text-0: Contractor, seems like you have a hunt.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_A_1-Text-0: Contractor, we've gotten wind of a team of researchers who've stopped responding to call requests.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_A_1-Text-0: Contractor, we've received a report of an incident at one of our labs- uh, I mean... someone else's lab.
D_Dialogue.GH_RG_A_INTRO-Text-0: Contractor, we've received intel on a mining outpost nearby.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_F_4-Text-5: Contractor? Right, give me a sec to see where you are.
D_Dialogue.GH_INTRO_BRIEFING-Text-4: Contracts will involve what we call Creatures of Interest. You'll be tasked with tracking, tagging, or hunting them depending on the work order.
D_Dialogue.BW4_005_COUNTERRESET-Text-1: Could be Inaris added a proximity failsafe.
D_Dialogue.ResearchBriefing2b-Text-3: Could be a good paycheck in it.
D_Dialogue.ExoticsAddOn1-Text-0: Could be exotics in the area, too, just sayin.
D_Dialogue.UnlockNewRecipe-Text-0: Could be that stuff's useful later.
D_Dialogue.Extraction2aOptionalObjective-Text-1: Could be worth searching the area for more exotics.
D_Dialogue.ExterminationStormWait-Text-2: Could be, you gotta wait for heavy weather.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_A_3-Text-5: Crap, I'm getting a call on another line.
D_Dialogue.Expedition4aLanding-Text-3: Crash zone's marked on your map.
D_Dialogue.TimerRunningOut10minsA-Text-0: Cutting it a bit close, aren't we?
D_Dialogue.DirectionValley1-Text-0: Cutting through that valley seems like your best option.
D_Dialogue.Ely_OpeningMission_Intro-Text-4: DAMN IT! TPS fired something at your pod.
D_Dialogue.PromFractureEvent12-Text-9: Dammit Mo! What about your family? Your crew? What about-
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionFive_3-Text-1: Dammit Theo! We need your help!
D_Dialogue.PromDispatchEvent2-Text-5: Dammit! I can't keep the signal up! dammit! hey prospector! Wait sh-... Oh god they traced the signal watch out!
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionFour_6-Text-4: Dammit! I should have known he'd set us up like this!
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_C3_4-Text-10: Dammit, what a mess! Sort it out.
D_Dialogue.ASHLANDS_RESCUE_CHURCH_INTRO-Text-1: Dammit. They should have been back by now. At this point we have to assume the worst.
D_Dialogue.Ely_OpeningMission_1-Text-3: Dammit. You'll need to send us a signal, for us to locate you.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_B_6-Text-11: Damn right, robot. Alright Contractor. We'll speak again soon.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionOne_2-Text-6: Damn straight they wouldn't, I don't lose.
D_Dialogue.PromNomadEvent4-Text-1: Damn toaster is supposed to be a replacement prospector guide.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionOne_1-Text-2: Damn! They made it? F--king hell, I just lost so... SO much money.
D_Dialogue.PromFractureEvent9-Text-0: Damn, looks like it's encrypted. I can get into it, but it's gonna take some time.
D_Dialogue.PromFractureEvent13-Text-0: Damn, that subwave locator won't shut off. If you can get out of this area, you might be out of range of their satellite signal.
D_Dialogue.RelocatedEvent7Line2-Text-0: Damn- that's a shame. Poor thing.
D_Dialogue.PromShadowedEvent13-Text-0: Damn. They really do want you in their ranks.
D_Dialogue.BW4_016_ONBOSSDEATH2-Text-1: Data from arctic bio-samples shows raised exotics levels.
D_Dialogue.PromNomadEvent1-Text-0: Data on this section of Icarus is limited and.. mostly classified.
D_Dialogue.V2PromNomadIntro-Text-1: Data on this section of Icarus is limited, and mostly classified.
D_Dialogue.LocationReached2-Text-0: Data says this is the area.
D_Dialogue.PromDispatchEvent6-Text-2: Data shows that, when powered, this device will... disturb local wildlife.
D_Dialogue.Expedition4bLocationReached1-Text-0: Data suggest there could be fragments round here.
D_Dialogue.FM4SurveyUplinkActivated-Text-1: Data's coming through clean and green.
D_Dialogue.IceSheetBriefing-Text-1: Data's pretty much non-existent in these parts.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionThree_11-Text-0: Dead, all of them, what a waste.
D_Dialogue.DeerRemark1-Text-0: Deer and smaller prey'll get spooked if you make too much noise.
D_Dialogue.DeviceInteractionProtect1-Text-0: Defend the tech, it won't work if they get to it.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_D2_6-Text-3: Defend this place and try to keep all your limbs while you're at it.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_C2_6-Text-7: Dennis knocked it over when he was trying to find his stash of Ren yesterday.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_E_3-Text-12: Dennis knocked it over when he was trying to find his stash of Ren yesterday.
D_Dialogue.StyxDExpeditionLanding-Text-1: Did have an exploration team get'n info for you.... Ah... This was their last communication:
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionFour_14-Text-0: Did they really have to? Why the hell did they do this?
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_ADD2_G2-Text-0: Did they really think a few morsels of the right food would cause this creature to bend to their whims?
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_D_1-Text-1: Did you ever think you'd find yourself covering up someone else's dirty work?
D_Dialogue.GH_AGENT_NEW_APE_C_03-Text-0: Did you fail a biochemistry degree back on Earth?
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionFive_3-Text-2: Did you happen to get a look at the size of that damn thing?! I didn't sign up for this bullsh**. I'm out.
D_Dialogue.ConfusedReaction7-Text-0: Did you really think that was a good idea?
D_Dialogue.CreatureRemarkLarge2-Text-0: Did you see the size of that thing?
D_Dialogue.PromOffenderIntro1-Text-4: Did... did that damn AI just call me old?
D_Dialogue.RecoveryBodiesLandingBodies-Text-1: Didn't get on too well, I gather.
D_Dialogue.RecoveryLanding4b-Text-1: Didn't make it to their supply drops.
D_Dialogue.GH_AGENT_NEW_APE_B_02-Text-0: Didn't think so. Time to get your hands dirty, meatbag.
D_Dialogue.GH_AGENT_NEW_APE_OPT1_02-Text-0: Didn't this guy say he was leaving the planet?
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_C2_8-Text-4: Ding dong. The lab is done.
D_Dialogue.GH_AGENT_NEW_APE_G_01-Text-3: Disturbed Prospector Eaten by the Ape They Were Trying to Make Friends With
D_Dialogue.GH_INTRO_BRIEFING-Text-1: Do I really have to read all of this? Fine, whatever.
D_Dialogue.GH_IM_NEW_D2_02-Text-2: Do be careful. Maybe this time, you won't electrocute yourself.
D_Dialogue.DH_Bark_Iris_22-Text-0: Do be safe out there, prospector!
D_Dialogue.DH_Bark_Theo_17-Text-0: Do not let your guard down, even for a second.
D_Dialogue.PromFractureEvent19-Text-7: Do not trust the Group, they do not honor their bargains. They only care about themselves.
D_Dialogue.PromNomadEvent9-Text-2: Do they think I'm just sitting on my ass circling a planet for fun? I do my damn job, kept more prospectors alive than most. But that's not good enough, noooo, I might see something they don't want eyes on. So it's-
D_Dialogue.V2PromNomadEvent9-Text-2: Do they think I'm just sitting on my ass circling a planet for fun? I do my damn job, kept more prospectors alive than most. But that's not good enough, noooo, I might see something they don't want eyes on. So it's-
D_Dialogue.GH_AGENT_NEW_APE_C_02-Text-0: Do you ever think for yourself? Or are you also programmed to simply follow orders?
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_D2_5-Text-0: Do you find your job.... satisfying?
D_Dialogue.DH_Bark_Iris_8-Text-0: Do you think they'll actually listen to our findings this time?
D_Dialogue.GH_AGENT_NEW_APE_F_02-Text-2: Do yourself a favour and prepare before heading out there.
D_Dialogue.GH_AGENT_NEW_APE_D2_04-Text-3: Does it keep you up at night?
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_B_5-Text-0: Does that one still have blood on it? Disgusting.
D_Dialogue.DH_Bark_Victor_3-Text-0: Don't ask me questions you don't need answers to.
D_Dialogue.RelocatedBriefing-Text-2: Don't ask me what they were doin' with em, that's above my paygrade.
D_Dialogue.GH_INTRO_BRIEFING-Text-9: Don't ask questions, don't steal anything, and don't talk to the UDA. It's really not that difficult...
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionSix_Intro-Text-6: Don't be ridiculous, Vic. If the chain reaction occurs then there's nowhere safe on this planet.
D_Dialogue.PromFractureEvent20-Text-7: Don't blow a gasket now, it's been sent to a secure, private server.
D_Dialogue.BW4_008_ITEMRETRIEVED1-Text-2: Don't drop it. Don't shake it. And whatever you do, DON'T open it.
D_Dialogue.RecoveryBodiesLandingBodies-Text-3: Don't even ask me how much that's gonna cost.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_ADD2_C1-Text-0: Don't even think about asking me where we got this laser from. It's a rental.
D_Dialogue.StyxCExpeditionLanding-Text-4: Don't forget to grab your radar from the dropship.
D_Dialogue.StyxIntroCollectEquipmentA-Text-0: Don't forget your beacons, can't transmit the data without 'em.
D_Dialogue.StyxBExpeditionCollectEquipmentA-Text-0: Don't forget, Radar is in your dropship.
D_Dialogue.DH_Bark_Iris_20-Text-0: Don't get too close to the containment area. Trust me.
D_Dialogue.ExtractionLanding4a-Text-1: Don't know if it's researchers or some damn bot telling 'em there's exotics in the region.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_ADD2_C2-Text-1: Don't let it get torn apart.
D_Dialogue.NULSEC_NPC_GRIFF_HURT_01-Text-0: Don't let me die out here.
D_Dialogue.NULSEC_NPC_WASHINGTON_HURT_02-Text-0: Don't let me die out here.
D_Dialogue.Expedition3Landing-Text-10: Don't let me hold you up.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_OPT1_1-Text-4: Don't let me stop you. I know there's nothing you lot love more than trying out new deathtraps.
D_Dialogue.Recon1FinishSubLevel10-Text-1: Don't say I didn't warn ya.
D_Dialogue.GH_IM_NEW_OZ1_04-Text-1: Don't start screaming or I'll change my mind.
D_Dialogue.FM2RecoveryCraftItem4-Text-1: Don't tell anyone - we'll just say you found it like that.
D_Dialogue.GH_IM_NEW_A2_01-Text-2: Don't think about it too hard, I wouldn't want you to exhaust yourself.
D_Dialogue.DH_ELY_EDEN_AUDIOLOG_1-Text-4: Don't worry about me, I'll be fine...
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionOne_11-Text-4: Don't worry though, I've got your back. I'm always ready for anything out here.
D_Dialogue.StyxCExpeditionMissionComplete-Text-3: Don't worry, I'll make sure you get paid.
D_Dialogue.GH_AGENT_NEW_APE_D2_01-Text-4: Don't worry, your secret's safe with me. I promise.
D_Dialogue.ExplorationBriefing4a-Text-1: Door's wide open, so do what you wanna do down there.
D_Dialogue.Expedition2bLanding-Text-4: Drop zones and the cave area are marked on your map.
D_Dialogue.RecoverySEBriefing-Text-1: Dropped gear for some kinda experiment and the weather tossed 'em halfway to Minos.
D_Dialogue.Expedition4bFoundFragment4-Text-1: Dropship came overhead, got spat at by one of those worm fellas, and fell outta the sky.
D_Dialogue.ReturnToDropship2-Text-0: Dropship's waiting, and ready when you are.
D_Dialogue.NULSEC_FINAL_SMPL3_INTRO-Text-1: Due to your previous experience in the Null Sector.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_B_3-Text-9: During the search one of our men reported sighting a strange creature that appeared to burrow underground when spotted.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionOne_Lore1-Text-7: Earth had riots, attacks. Over our way, Prospectors started to defect.
D_Dialogue.Expedition3LocationReached1-Text-2: Easy for me to say - you're the one's gotta do it.
D_Dialogue.StockPileBriefing3-Text-3: Easy money for someone who knows what they're doin'
D_Dialogue.BW4_016_ONBOSSDEATH2-Text-3: Either that, or they just really don't like you.
D_Dialogue.GH_RG_A_INTRO-Text-5: Either they walked off the job or there's something else at play here.
D_Dialogue.GenericBriefingGroupFifteen1-Text-2: Either way, so long as you don't ask any questions they are happy to hand us a nice little payment for taking it down.
D_Dialogue.PromNomadEvent5-Text-2: Either way, we need that blueprint.
D_Dialogue.V2PromNomadEvent2-Text-2: Either way, we need that chip.
D_Dialogue.BW4_005_COUNTERRESET-Text-3: Either way,you'll need to reactivate it.
D_Dialogue.PromShadowedEvent5-Text-3: Enough for the predictive algorithms to prove out we failed.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_END_1-Text-3: Enzyme research has been banned for a long time, for good reason.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_B_7-Text-6: Enzymes? Oh god no, that needs to be kept under wraps AGENT.
D_Dialogue.SMPL3_GENERIC_17-Text-0: Error, the scan has failed to complete.
D_Dialogue.NULSEC_FINAL_SMPL3_INTRO-Text-7: Escort the target out of the Black Zone. We will arrange a comfortable ship to transport you both back to our facility in orbit. Refreshments and lodgings will be provided, free of charge.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_END_4-Text-1: Establishing a secure link to speed dial contact: My Favourite Boss.
D_Dialogue.Recon_Low_Water-Text-2: Even a basic envirosuit'll filter out anything dangerous.
D_Dialogue.SpecialGenericLanding3-Text-0: Even by Icarus standards, this one's a challenge.
D_Dialogue.AshlandsEvent3-Text-2: Every bit of data the UDA pulls is just... scrambled. Completely unusable.
D_Dialogue.FactionRemarkUniao1-Text-0: Everyone knows that Uniao doesn't give a damn about Icarus.
D_Dialogue.ResearchLanding4b-Text-0: Everyone knows the terrazone's changing - but no-one's sure where it's goin'.
D_Dialogue.PromNomadEvent12End-Text-1: Everyone out here is starting from scratch, gotta prove your mettle.
D_Dialogue.V2PromNomadEvent12-Text-2: Everyone out here is starting from scratch, gotta prove your mettle.
D_Dialogue.ExterminationNocturnalWait2-Text-0: Everything you found suggests a nocturnal hunter
D_Dialogue.GenericLandingGetSupplies4-Text-0: Everything you'll need is in that crate.
D_Dialogue.GenericLandingGetSupplies5-Text-0: Everything you'll need is stowed in your ship.
D_Dialogue.StyxIntroLocation3Complete-Text-0: Excellent work Prospector, that's all we need from this spot.
D_Dialogue.BW3Complete-Text-2: Exotics are a mystery, but soon we're gonna know a little more about how this planet really works.
D_Dialogue.RecoverySEGotItem-Text-1: Experimental ACS exotics tech, by the look of it.
D_Dialogue.BW5_002_EXITDROPSHIP-Text-1: Exploration teams reported a cave system. Could be a path down there. But that was the last anyone heard from them.
D_Dialogue.Expedition2bLanding-Text-2: Exploration teams reported a cave system. Could be a path down there. But that was the last anyone heard from them.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionThree_1-Text-3: Extra points for any TPS you put down along the way.
D_Dialogue.ExtractionLanding4a-Text-4: Extractor'll come in handy too, if you manage to find something.
D_Dialogue.AshlandsWarning-Text-2: Extreme weather and temperature fluctuations are frequent.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionSix_10-Text-0: F***, her helmet. We're too late. She tricked us.
D_Dialogue.PromNomadEvent11-Text-3: Factions are starting to use 'em for payment deliveries too.
D_Dialogue.PromTempestEvent9-Text-2: Factions tend to hold a grudge, the Group worst of all.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_OPT1_3-Text-0: Fantastic, you managed to get this far without serious injury. Let's see if it stays that way.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_OPT2_1-Text-0: Finally, a decision that makes sense.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_OPT3_1-Text-6: Find the infected creatures and put them out of their misery.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_OPT4_1-Text-6: Find the infected creatures and put them out of their misery.
D_Dialogue.SurveyUplink3-Text-2: Find the unit, and deploy it nearby.
D_Dialogue.PromFractureEvent18-Text-4: Fine, not people as we know them, but still, the poor creatures.
D_Dialogue.GH_IM_NEW_OZ1_05-Text-2: Fine, that's the last time you'll get any help from me.
D_Dialogue.GH_RG_A_FOUND_LOGS-Text-1: Fine. I'll start processing these but it will take time to reformat the files.
D_Dialogue.Expedition3ActivateBeacon2-Text-0: Fire it up when you're ready.
D_Dialogue.Scanning4aLanding-Text-3: First site's marked on your map, so grab a radar and let's do this.
D_Dialogue.Scanning4bLanding-Text-2: First site's marked on your map.
D_Dialogue.ResearchLanding2b-Text-3: First stop's marked on your map.
D_Dialogue.OpenWorldIntroSRR-Text-0: First things first - If you wanna complete missions for the UDA, you'll need to craft a Short Range radio.
D_Dialogue.DH_Bark_Theo_9-Text-0: Focus up, pay attention, you'll live longer.
D_Dialogue.GH_AGENT_NEW_APE_A_01-Text-0: Follow the trail, moron. Unless you want to end up mauled like Morris.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_C2_1-Text-4: For Norex to sponsor a lab right under the UDA's nose is a big deal.
D_Dialogue.AllItemsFound2-Text-0: For my money, that's all of them
D_Dialogue.PromFractureEvent19-Text-11: For now, I'll keep hiding, keep exploring. Seems the least I could do is learn more about them.
D_Dialogue.GH_RG_A_FOUND_LOGS-Text-3: For now, it's time to check back in with Norex.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionTwo_8-Text-2: For now, thanks for helping out.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_OPT3_1-Text-8: For once, your murder may actually be mercy. Almost.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_OPT4_1-Text-8: For once, your murder may actually be mercy. Almost.
D_Dialogue.PromDispatchEvent1-Text-0: For this assignment you'll need a beacon. We don't want to give away your location, so you will need to make one from scratch.
D_Dialogue.SurveyUplink1-Text-0: For this much data, you're gonna need an uplink to connect you to orbit.
D_Dialogue.PromShadowedEvent9-Text-3: Foraging is slow, Doesn't feel defensible here. Scout for better HQ locations-
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_A_1-Text-4: Fortunately for Norex that often works out for us.
D_Dialogue.PromDispatchEvent2-Text-0: Friend, friend! You need to be careful.. They're choking comms, I haven't got much time.
D_Dialogue.PromFractureEvent7-Text-3: Friend, we've known each other a while. And I've never done you wrong.
D_Dialogue.PromShadowedEvent5-Text-2: From memory, this was where we saw the first signs of terraforming washout.
D_Dialogue.GH_AGENT_NEW_APE_A_04-Text-0: From the notes on this lab that is not a lab, it says the creatures have Biochips installed.
D_Dialogue.DeliveryItemTemperatureDependent-Text-2: Generally, we do not intercede with Contractors, but this mission is of extreme importance.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_B_1-Text-3: Genetic splicing is delicate work, adding enzymes into the mix is just about the worst possible thing they could have done.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_A_4-Text-1: Genetic splicing, blah blah, new species... Rimetusks, what a name.
D_Dialogue.Expedition2aDeviceAssembled-Text-1: Geniuses at the Group reckon walls won't stop it working.
D_Dialogue.SurveyBriefing3-Text-0: Geomagnetic readings in the region have got them freaking out.
D_Dialogue.SurveyBriefing4a-Text-0: Geomorphic activity in this area's got 'em scratching their heads.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionThree_1-Text-2: Get a move on new blood, you got a big hike ahead.
D_Dialogue.StyxBExpeditionLeavingScanningAreaD-Text: Get back in range of the scanner.
D_Dialogue.TimerRunningOut5minsC-Text-0: Get back to the ship, NOW!
D_Dialogue.BW4_020_COUNTERRESET3-Text-1: Get in there and reactivate it.
D_Dialogue.DevicePaused4-Text-1: Get it back online, or you're gonna be here for a while.
D_Dialogue.RecoveryLandingGeneric1-Text-3: Get it before anyone else does, then bring it back to orbit.
D_Dialogue.CreatureRemarkPostFight4-Text-0: Get out of there and find somewhere to recover.
D_Dialogue.PromFractureEvent13Warning2-Text-0: Get out of there friend! We need to break the signal.
D_Dialogue.DirectionNextStop4-Text-0: Get out your map for your next location.
D_Dialogue.PromNomadBriefing-Text-0: Get ready prospector. Thanks to Group 15, we just got access to a previously off-limits part of Icarus.
D_Dialogue.V2PromNomadBriefing-Text-0: Get ready prospector. Thanks to Group 15, we just got access to a previously off-limits part of Icarus.
D_Dialogue.PromFractureEvent4-Text-2: Get rid of them so we can search for information.
D_Dialogue.Expedition4aReachAvalanche-Text-1: Get that heat gun sorted and set up.
D_Dialogue.SurveyReachLocation2-Text-1: Get that station into the water.
D_Dialogue.RecoverySELanding-Text-2: Get the gear from each of 'em.
D_Dialogue.GenericGetItemsToCargoPod2-Text-0: Get the stuff to the cargo pod.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_END_3-Text-2: Get those parts salvaged and up to us ASAP, the longer you take the more they'll break down.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionSix_Briefing-Text-2: Get to Eden and come and see me, NOW.
D_Dialogue.WeatherEvent1-Text-1: Get to shelter or you're in trouble.
D_Dialogue.PromOffenderEvent3-Text-2: Get up there and see what you can find.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionFour_End-Text-5: Get yourself back to Eden immediately, Prospector. We need to come up with a plan, now.
D_Dialogue.BW5_006_EXITCAVE-Text-3: Get yourself to the scanning zone.
D_Dialogue.StormReactionSevere11-Text-0: Gettin' hit by lightning is a shit way to die.
D_Dialogue.ScanWeatherComplete2-Text-1: Getting a lotta good data out that already.
D_Dialogue.StockpileLanding0-Text-2: Getting the raw materials off this planet, that's the killer.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_B_4-Text-9: Getting up close and personal with a... uh... a fortune worth of exotics...
D_Dialogue.ExterminationNocturnalWait1-Text-1: Gives you some time to get prepared.
D_Dialogue.Ely_OpeningMission_Intro-Text-0: Glad to have you on board prospector.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_D_3-Text-1: Go ahead and trade in those gleefully stolen items of yours.
D_Dialogue.GH_AGENT_NEW_APE_E_01-Text-2: Go ahead, I can't wait to see how this turns out.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_E_1-Text-2: Go ahead, I can't wait to see how this turns out.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionOne_8-Text-8: Go and introduce yourself to the rest of the team.
D_Dialogue.GH_RCKGLM_F_1-Text-3: Go and stab things until I say we're done.
D_Dialogue.IceSheetEnding-Text-3: Go get some rest friend, you've earned it.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_B_1-Text-2: Go help him, and see what you can find out about their research.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_OPT1_1-Text-3: Go on then, pick up your weapon of choice and let's get started.
D_Dialogue.DH_Bark_Victor_18-Text-0: God there are so many of them, they're everywhere.
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionFour_9-Text-3: God, why isn't Vic picking up?
D_Dialogue.DH_Bark_Theo_4-Text-0: Goddamn TPS constantly on my ass.
D_Dialogue.PromOffenderEvent8-Text-1: Goddamn bot, getting in the way, treating me like I'm obsolete, cost-saving UD..A ...
D_Dialogue.Ely_MissionFour_End-Text-0: Gone? All of the prototype equipment, the enzymes, the paperwork.
D_Dialogue.ConstructionArriveGeneric1-Text-1: Good a spot as any, I guess.
D_Dialogue.FM3ExterminationMarker1-Text-1: Good find, but we need more.
D_Dialogue.GH_APE_D_4-Text-0: Good job I guess, praising you isn't part of my programming.
D_Dialogue.GH_ICEMAM_C_5-Text-0: Good job contractor. You did so good at the murder.
